text: When I was looking for an attorney for my divorce about a year ago, I did not know where to start. When I had gotten my finances in order to pay for my divorce, he took the lead on everything.  From the process server, to the mediator, to the military statements that pertained to all my benefits as a 20 plus years devoted military spouse, Mitchell J. His paralegal also was nonchalant in communication as she doesn't care.  I would not recommend him to a dead dog and I have contacted Legal Shield and recommend  that he be removed from Legal Shield as he does not represent or stand for what Legal Shield is about. resp.text:
Dear Mr. Knowles,

I regret that you are unhappy with the outcome of your case, which was concluded when you indicated to the judge in open court that you understood and approved the agreement with your ex-wife for the entry of a judgment against your ex-wife, for which judgment your ex-wife has been paying since.  My records show that the judgment was entered and sent to you in January of 2017, some seven months prior to your review.  You have been notified immediately upon receipt of all payments made against the judgment, and you directed my office to hold those payments for you while you were in the process of moving.   Since that time, you have picked up all of the payments that your ex-wife has sent to this office.  Your ex-wife has your new address to send further payments directly to you.  I understand that you have also sought to garnish your ex-wife, and my paralegal communicated to you the cost of a consultation for further proceedings, which you declined to pay.  My paralegal did then  direct you to the appropriate clerk's office at the courthouse so that you could initiate further collection proceedings on your own if you chose to do so, even though your ex-wife has been making payments against the judgment.  I certainly appeared at the trial setting at which we obtained the judgment  against your ex-wife.  If you had wanted me to appear at any subsequent proceedings, you would have had to arrange for my further representation, which you did not.

name: Josh Kemp
text: I used Mr. Campbell for my divorce/child custody case. It was an uncontested divorce except for the fact that my ex wanted child support. Well, I didn't know any better, and I knew she wouldn't sign the papers if there was no child support so I agreed to give her what Mr. Campbell had come up with: $400. My ex originally wanted something like $650 per month so I looked at that as a win. Well, after talking with different people who have joint legal and physical custody like I do, they wonder why in the hell am I paying my ex ANY child support, since I have her week on and week off. And, after talking with two different lawyers, they wonder the same thing. The lawyer I have now told me if I'd taken our case to court, the judge would NOT have awarded child support to my ex. We will be going back to court needless to say, will definitely not be using Mr. Campbell who screwed me over.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Kemp, I appreciate the opportunity to have assisted with your case, but I do wish you had taken an opportunity to follow up with me about these concerns.  I did leave a message for you to call me concerning this matter, but I have not heard back from you.  I can address your concerns here.  As you might recall, you came to me to fix the agreement that you had tried to file on your own and that the court had rejected.  Without going into the details of the numbers involved with your case (which details are a matter of record) I can confidently say that you would likely have been ordered to pay around $400 per month in child support if you were awarded true joint physical custody after a trial.  If you had tried your case and been awarded joint legal custody, with your wife being awarded sole physical custody, you would have likely been ordered to pay around $650 per month.  Note that there is a difference between joint physical, versus joint legal, custody.  In Alabama, child support must still be calculated, and the judge still must state whether or not Rule 32 has been followed, even in joint physical custody situations.  This means that one party who makes significantly more than the other may still have to pay an amount of child support, and the method used to calculate $400 per month in your case is one that is accepted by the courts.  If two people make the same income, or have an agreement to deviate from guidelines, it is possible to have an order without child support.  Those conditions were not present in your situation.  The alternative would have been to pay me (or another lawyer) much more money to take your case to trial, and make an argument for custody and support, the result of which would not have been a certainty (and could result in less favorable terms of custody and having to pay more support than your agreement).  I'll be glad to explain this to the other persons that have provided feedback to you, as I fear that they must be either misinformed as to the facts or the law.  I am glad to have had the opportunity to assist you, and I will be happy to follow up with you concerning any questions that you have about this matter.

name: Integrity dowhatisright
text: Davis Varner was hired to represent a family member in court on a CRO Violation. When we spoke to Davis during the free consultation, he made you believe that the judge wouldn't sentence you to jail for a violation like that. We explained everything up front. He had all the information that was going to be brought up in court.  He acted like there was a possible of getting color code extended for few more months. He said I just don't see that judge sentencing you to jail. We had confidence in Davis that he would do a great job. I looked at the law firm website they had a section on color code violation. They acted like they had experience in handling these cases. Court day came and we didn't have a very good outcome. The worst thing possible happened. Davis didn't do anything to help his client. I wouldn't hire him again to represent anybody in a CRO Violation. You would be better off going with the court appointed attorney. Terrible experience!

name: EddyGordo21
text:
My mother has been dealing with this law firm for an abundance of years, and her experience has been far from stellar. This place moved three times since she has been their client, and they never informed her until she called them herself because they do not contact her. David, the person with whom she asks to speak, is constantly dodging her because he is always "out of the office" or "with another 'more important' client." I'm sure NONE of those "more important" clients have been as equanimous with them as she has.

David has apparently trained his staff to dodge her as well since she called them, and Alice refused to answer the phone (probably because of caller ID) but when I called, she answered the phone just to place us on hold to retrieve something so minuscule that it took less than 30 seconds to do...

Apparently this lawyer and his team care nothing about their clients--and dare I say clients of color... But this is the behavior that is typical of many businesses in the north central region of Alabama. Once the better business bureau is contacted, however, maybe they will change their tone.

If she had not contacted the actual courthouse to get her court date, she would not have even known of the impending court date. After calling these people several times, they refused to give her any of her case details.

So with regard to the other negative review this institution has received, I do NOT agree with the owner that "it is the work of a competitor." I have seen these practices first-hand, and I am far from a capital seeking adversary.

resp.text:
Because we don't recognize your name and you don't appear to be a client of our firm, based off your screen name, there's no way for us to address this issue without knowing the exact name of the client. We also do not have, nor have we ever had, any employees by the name of David or Alice. Are you sure you have the correct firm?

In relation to your comment about "people of color," approximately half of our clients are non-caucasion clients and are "people of color." We have dedicated this firm to representing clients who have been injured, oppressed, overlooked and not been treated fairly, regardless of their designation. Over the years, the lawyers and staff of our firm have also volunteered countless hours of their personal time participating in charities and outreach programs that benefit all segments of our community.

Although we're respectful of your opinion, the assertions you've made about the issue of race are reckless and inaccurate and thats clearly proven by 17 years of close relationships with people of all genders, races and socio-economic statuses that are repeat clients. Many people leaving reviews on this very site are "people of color" and would strongly disagree with your statement and actually take offense to it. Writing a negative review about a business that's never represented you is one thing but making baseless accusations of racial unfairness about people you don't know and who have spent their careers representing underprivileged segments of our state and communities is something else.

If your mother is dissatisfied with any service that any lawyer or staff member of our firm has ever provided, then please have your mother, personally, reach out immediately and ask for the head practice manager so that we can rectify this matter.

We take any client dis-satisfaction very seriously and want every client to be satisfied with our efforts. If your mother is, indeed, a past or current client, then any concerns your mother has will be given our complete attention and we will do our very best to address her concerns.

name: Melanie Daugherty
text: Josh O'Neal is the absolute worst attorney I have ever had. He refuses to return phone calls. He called me ONE TIME during my divorce, the day before the hearing. He never even bothered to send me the final divorce decree. I had no idea what my divorce papers said until his secretary emailed them to me, after the THIRD request. I know all of his secretaries because they are the only ones I could ever talk to. Half the time, they didn't return phone calls either. Halfway through the 'mediation' I got the distinct feeling that he was working for the other side. He obviously thinks he can make a living by gaining clients, screwing them over, and going on to the next victim. He must be too young and immature to grasp the concept that most people will need an attorney more than ONCE in their lifetime, and if he thinks he can be successful without the benefit of repeat clients, he is delusional. If he was the last attorney on earth, I would never hire him again. My divorce is final; I'm still missing half my belongings; he's promised me a refund twice and never delivered. On top of that, he suggested we file a contempt motion because of the fact that I was not given all the belongings I was entitled to. He didn't mention at the time that he planned on charging me an additional $1500 to do what I'd already paid him to do. In my opinion, the reason all his pictures on FB look like gangster photos is because he is a crook. He will stand there and 'listen' to you, but he is just pretending to hear you. You'd have more luck talking to a brick wall. Plus the brick wall might return your calls. I read a bad review of his, and I should have heeded it. If you need a great attorney, contact Michael Haynes.

name: Jonathan Lusk
text: As a practicing attorney myself, I was well aware of this law firm's excellent reputation before I selected them to handle a lawsuit on behalf of my family. The firm lived up to its reputation and more.  Attorneys Tim Davis and Mark Ekonen handled our case. They both worked tirelessly all the way through to a successful settlement. My family and I could not be more pleased with their legal expertise and consummate professionalism. Moving forward, I will refer clients to Heninger Garrison Davis without reservation. Take it from an attorney who knows the difference between average and superior legal representation -- if you have been wronged and need a top flight law firm in your corner to achieve the best possible result, contact Heninger Garrison Davis.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Jonathan! It means so much coming from a fellow member of the legal community. All the best to you and your family!

name: Jacklyn Stegman
text:
After our bad accident (a semi truck merged into us at 65mph) myself and my mother-in-law were referred to Heninger Garrison Davis as the people who could help us the best. Let me tell you, they were right. The people we worked closest with were Mark,  Eric, and Beverly, and they are all so friendly and helpful.

Even considering that I moved to a different timezone shortly after the accident, I still felt that I was able to easily communicate with them about any questions or concerns I was having (they respond with most efficiency to email in my experience).

During negotiations with the other party (which lets face it, thats the part all of us care about the most) I was shocked by how willing this practice was to work with us and help us obtain the settlement we needed to finally put this ugly event behind us. While I sincerly hope that I am never in another situation that would call for it, I would happily use this law firm again and/or refer them to any friend or family member in need of legal representation.

We do pride ourselves on our clear communication and full disclosure of all fees at the beginning of any client relationship. For that reason, we would like the opportunity to talk with you and investigate your feedback further. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at 205-327-9121 at your convenience so we may discuss how to possibly resolve your issues. Thanks again.

T. Gauldin – Firm Admin

text: I met Martin in the lobby of the Social Security Office of Hearings and Appeals in Jackson, MS. I was alone and scared of what I was about to encounter. I ask Martin to represent me and he accepted. The ALJ sent his assistant out to the lobby to ask me if I would like to postpone my hearing so I would have more time to prepare my case and get an attorney. I signed a contract with Martin that day. He was always available when I needed to talk to him and if he did have a timing conflict, he would always get back with me and answer my questions completly. He was very thorough in every aspect, and he eased my nerves about the whole process. Martin is a super nice person and he is very family oriented , and that says alot about a person's capabilities when hiring an attorney. I highly recommend Attorney Martin Weinberg for all of your legal needs.

name: David Engen
text: Not responsive on Chapter 7 questions about IRS issues. Was also billed $310 in addition to $1,000 fee for filing. Still no resolution!

resp.text:
To prospective clients:  negative comments are always a chance to improve services.

A flat legal fee is most common for a ch 7 bankruptcy case and has a limited set of itemized services.  There is in every case a written Attorney Services Fee Agreement.  Our Attorney Fee Agreement does  not cover legal questions months, or as in the above comment, years, after the case is concluded.   Secondly,  most federal and state taxes cannot be discharged.

We maintain a high level of 5 star reviews because we do not take every case, and because we strictly follow our employment agreements.  Time is a finite resource, and is a lawyer’s only tradeable  asset.

Former clients cannot take precedent over existing clients who have paid, and contracted for representation in a pending, filed case.  We will endeavor to answer questions from former clients,  but we cannot provide free legal services if a new legal issue arises, or if further consultation is desired. This again is spelled out in the Attorney Services Fee Agreement in every case we take on.

We sometimes cannot respond to people we no longer represent because of time obligations to existing clients, and we cannot solve all legal issues.

We didn't know that he had moved to Alabama until 2-3 years into the case. We only found out when we called the trustees office. The judge then made him turn his cases over to another lawyer that has no invested interest in our case. We are over $1,000 over paid and very frustrated.

We know that he left just weeks after our filing so it was a planned move and we should have been told as we would have found another attorney that was going to fight for us.

Thanks for nothing!

name: Raven McWilliams
text:
I had the pleasure of working with Dell Cross and Justin Smith. They were everything that I was seeking for an attorney. Before choosing Cross & Smith, the insurance company was offering me mere pennies. They were really taking advantage of me not understanding the process of a personal injury claim. I would ask them questions and it was obvious that they were withholding information from me. They were pressuring me to settle without an attorney. I could tell they were trying to intimidate me.

I chose Cross & Smith and was awarded "10x" the offer the insurance company originally offered me. It was more than I imagined and more than what I would have settled for, if I had to do it alone.

There were no surprises, no hidden fees, they explained everything every step of the way. I would also like to give a special thanks to Leslie Bradley. Leslie kept me updated through phone conversations and emails. Their staff offers nothing but warm hospitality. I was treated as an individual, not a mere client.

It was an extremely fast process, when compared to other people's testimony.  I couldn't have asked for better. I HIGHLY recommend choosing Cross & Smith if you have a personal injury claim!

text: I hired Lloyd & Hogan for a personal injury after being hit by a drunk driver. The folks I dealt with failed to honor their word. Do not take anything said in conversation as truth. Also, they continually urged me to settle the case for less than what I should have received. I am left with nerve damage in my neck, which causes tremmors in my right hand. The fiirm made out well.

name: Anon 23
text: If possible, I'd give this firm negative stars. I STRONGLY advise you choose a different firm to represent you. They are a very poor excuse for attorney's. They don't care about you as a person or a case and will not devote the attention deserved. I talked to other lawyers in hopes to fire the one I had in this firm and regret every single day for not doing it. The small cost I would have had to pay to switch lawyers at the point I was at in my case would have been worth it because the rest of my life is affected due to the lack of concern and legal advice provided. If I could keep even one person from having been poorly represented by these people it would be worth it. Don't make the mistake I made. Hire Alexander Shunnarah before you throw your case away with Lloyd and Hogan.

resp.text: Anon 23, are sorry that you did not have a good experience with our firm. We have checked our records and do not see any files under your name, but we appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at 205-969-6235 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Tracy Causey
text:
DO NOT USE THIS FIRM!!!!

My brother hired Lloyd and Hogan in Birmingham for help with his disability.   He can never talk to anyone and leaving a message is a joke!  His wife has done all the leg work on this case.  He has been diagnosed with Stage 4 Cancer and when his wife finally spoke with his case worker, she was told his court date for February 2019 could not be moved up!!!  OMG...praying he makes it to February.
DO NOT USE THIS FIRM!!!!!

resp.text: Ms. Causey, I am sorry that you have these feelings, but following the receipt of your review we have spoken with your brother and his wife, who we actually represent, and they do not share your feelings. I suggest you speak with them, and if they have any issues they are of course welcome to contact us to discuss. However, according to our clients, they are very satisfied with our services, as well as the timeliness of services provided and the work ethic of all involved in the handling of their case.

However since the impound owner works with the Calhoun County courthouses and Sheriff's the magistrates at Calhoun County Courthouse would not let me swear a warrant on the owner of the impound lot but then all of a sudden after getting a small claims paperwork to file against them I suddenly have a warrant for assault charges when I never assaulted anybody court systems there would not even allow me to call my Witnesses that would prove that he is a liar and proved that the Calhoun County Court System is unjust but since supposedly I got in a fight with the owner which I never did I only was defending myself and never threw any punches only foul language however they would not represent me for the case

name: John Tatter
text: I engaged Whit Drake to represent me after I was injured in a motorcycle accident. Under the circumstances, I didn't want to have to deal with insurance companies, and I had no idea how to handle settlements. Whit and his staff took care of everything, answered all of my questions, and kept me informed throughout the process. He was able to negotiate with my health-care insurance to reduce the amount of their demand for reimbursement, and he worked with my own automobile insurance company to get the best settlement possible under the underinsured motorist rider in my policy. Given the limits in coverage under both my own and the other driver's policies, Whit kindly reduced the percentage of the settlement that he took for his fee. I hope I never need to use a personal injury attorney again, but if I do, it will be Whit Drake. Essentially, what he and his firm offer is peace of mind.

name: Miocia Brown
text: I received services from the Birmingham location and would totally recommend Brock & Stout for your bankruptcy needs. Everyone I encountered was very personable and genuine in assisting me. Misty was very knowledgeable and thorough when going over my paperwork and informing me about the process. They give you the option of a payment plan for your court costs and offer the convenience of paying your trustee fee over the phone, avoiding the trouble of having to find parking in downtown Birmingham. They also set up a telephone interview with you prior to your court date with the trustee to go over possible questions they may be asked. The filing fee was also very affordable. See Brock & Stout for your bankruptcy needs and you won't be disappointed.

name: Michael Blackwood
text: They are professional and do a great job of handling your legal needs and concerns and that is what you pay a lawyer to do. I was satisfied with the fact that I felt that I got what I paid for. I have used other law firms in the past for things unrelated to a bankruptcy, so I knew in advance what to expect from a competent, experienced and knowledgeable group of attorneys. They have always handled my legal concerns in a timely, professional and competent manner. They even went above and beyond, on more than one occasion, to assist me and did things for me that I really did feel were outside the scope of what I had paid them to do and I even expected to be charged more for their services and would have been happy to pay additionally for the services they provided to me. That is enough to warrant an excellent referral to the point I would be more than happy to recommend them to all of my friends and family, but that's not where their professional services ended. Truthfully what I am more impressed with and what has meant so much to me personally is the fact they have a "heart". When you get a letter in the mail that you don't understand and need help deciphering the "legalese" you can call and speak to someone like "Morgan". She's not just someone answering their phone. You helped me understand what it was that I got in the mail and set up an appointment to speak to attorney the next day. That all wonderful, but what meant the most was that she listened to me, the struggle I have had since the pandemic and how my financial circumstances have worsened. She helped me relax she offered an ear to listen to me and a heart to respond to me, not as just a client of their law firm, but as a human. She gave me kind hearted conversation that's given me the strength to relax until I speak to the attorney tomorrow. That is priceless! I don't know how you can assign a dollar figure for something like that, but it reinforces the opinion that I sought out the best law firm I could find to help me with this matter and "Morgan" cemented the opinion to me that I made the right decision. If you need a lawyer to handle your legal affairs, that watches out for your best interest, doesn't charge you again to assist you you when you have additional needs that arise out of your bankruptcy and most importantly to me, has your back and cares about how this is impacting your life and you emotionally, call Brock and Stout. They will take care of you professionally, legally and in my case emotionally when I absolutely needed it the most; you won't regret your decision. I never leave reviews for companies because I am usually so busy. Today "Morgan" just went so far out of her way, not just to answer the phone, not just to help interpret the letter I received in the mail, not even to set up a much needed appointment with the attorney; she helped me moby listening and having a heart so I can continue to make it through this very stressful time in my life. In the midst of all my financial struggles and hardship God has a plan and I know that calling Brock and Stout was part of that plan.

resp.text: It has been our pleasure to help you. We understand that sometimes you fall on hard times and just need an understanding and helping hand. We are glad to help you get a financial fresh start. Thanks for the heartfelt review and recommendation.

name: Neysa Manuel
text:
Scott Hughes has represented me in a very difficult family issue for several years. From Circuit Court to Family Court to Appellate Court.  He is the most professional, knowledgeable, honest, caring attorney I have ever known. He has been a LIFE SAVER for me and my family. Randall pleaded with the judge for us not having to go to court when not necessary because of travel distance from Amarillo. Instead, Randall represented us everytime and was Our Voice in court when we weren't present. Every time after a court hearing, more and more worked in our favor. He convinced the judge if one more slip up from my wife's ex then our daughter (my step daughter) would come back home to Amarillo,Texas on a one way ticket permanently. Better yet, our daughter and her father moved back to Texas in fear of losing custody. Randall was outstanding and Mary(his assistant) was So Extremely Friendly. Both Down to Earth! Is he recommended? With No Doubt! A True Blessing!

name: Tommy Vercetti
text:
This is what I call a back office lawyer.

Attorneys like this are only looking to send a letter possibly make a phone call and get you some compensation they don’t like seeing the inside of a court room they don’t like pursuing cases that are potentially difficult they are only looking for the quick money.

They take 30-60% of the settlement amount for simply writing a letter demanding compensation.

There is nothing wrong with taking a fee there is nothing wrong with sending a letter demanding compensation.

The problem lies in the fact that the attorney is not interested in pursuing your case far enough to get real compensation.

Attorneys like the set back in their offices on their computer and phones all day but rarely make it to the courtroom.

This is why they’re not charging fees when they Are not able to provide you with favorable results reason being is because they don’t have much invested they don’t have a lot of time invested they don’t have anything material wise invested other than maybe a sheet of paper in an envelope.

resp.text:
We have no record of ever representing a Thomas Vercetti. We believe this review to be fraudulent.

In any event, our goal is to provide the absolute highest level of legal representation. We are committed to our clients’ cases and are willing to do whatever is necessary to obtain justice.

Reviews like this one are not only inaccurate, but they do a disservice to our staff who work diligently in service to our clients.

name: Sean Blasingame
text: Best personal injury lawyer in the state. Hope you or a loved one is never hurt but if you have to sue an insurance company, this is your guy in Alabama. Tyler used to work as an insurance adjuster (i believe thats the official title) which means his paperwork is always the way the insurance company wants it when it is submitted. Therefore his claims will prob be put on top of the stack compared to other attorneys. It was in my case. Me personally, i was hurt in a car accident on I-65 and was worried i couldnt pay the medical bills. After having 2 sprained ankles and other various injuries(none too serious, thankfully) i ended up in a financial bind and needed the case settled quickly. He had my case settled and doubled the money i received in my hand in just 3 weeks compared to when i broke my back with another injury attorney that took over 2 years. Not only does he do a great job, he seems to genuinely be a good person and will help you all he can (his secretary, too!). Lastly, Tyler doesnt seem worried at all about taking your case to trial if he needs to. This attorney will not just try to settle your case and then pass you off to other attorneys if your case isnt an easy "cut and dry" claim which is VERY common in personal injury cases. I personally believe he will do a better job than ANY other injury lawyer for you because he did just that for me and he is still helping my father who was in the wreck with me but hurt worse.

I hate I didn’t do it on my own.

Went against what client wanted and settled for an amount of money that benefited them. There is absolutely no reason for this case to have been mishandled and their client neglected in this way. They wanted to cut a deal to settle the case with the defendant and their insurance after their client tells them no. They do it anyway. So who are they representing??? There was plenty of evidence of the other driving being completely at fault.

text: I have to say that I am extremely impressed with this law firm! The receptionist who answered the phone helped me as much as she could with my general questions and then passed my information on to a member of their legal team. From there,  Billy Elliott called and was one hundred percent HONEST with me and didn't try to take advantage of my legal ignorance. He took the time to give me some extrmely valuable advice over the phone without ever being retained by me! He gave me detailed explanations and responses to my questions and really helped me to figure out what I should expect from the insurance company! I am positive that this will be my go-to legal firm for all future incidents and the one I would recommend to anyone who is looking for an attorney. If you are on the fence about who to use, because there are so many out there, LOOK NO FURTHER! Andy Citrin's office and staff are amazing!

My ex and I went into an UNCONTESTED adoption and this was starting in Aug 18’ and it finally went to court middle of Dec 18’. I received attitude that was unjustified when I called for my updates when they said they would call. Due to my ex paying for said adoption they used profanity at me and said we will speak to our client, do not call us anymore! That was ridiculously unprofessional!  I have been nothing but truly helpful and the only time I got true updates was when I went in person! I gave 99.9%of all documents required. Any update you ask for or they offer will not happen.

My child was born out of state and we are trying to get them to send the necessary papers out to get a new birth certificate issued and I’ve gotten the biggest run around! They even told me to do it myself when they were paid to do this service! I respectfully stated that they had from August to get this sorted and asked why it was taking so long and that’s where the assistant “Toni” used profanity then assumed to go onto a rant and hung up on me because I asked a simple question..if that shouldn’t throw a flag idk what would. They point blame and don’t take responsibility for their shortcomings and bill for service that shouldn’t have to happen! DHR lost the papers...”oh I’m not sure when I can get to it” ...they are a joke! When the court hearing happened they didn’t even have all the papers necessary even though we showed up prepared! And getting our copies of said papers took even longer! “Oh he hasn’t checked the box”
Their office is legit across the street from the court house! Please I urge anyone who might stumble upon this DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME and MONEY with this poor excuse of a legal office! I’ll be happy to answer any and all questions y’all have :) please make good choices when selecting a good lawyer!

I have known Inge for several years, beginning when he helped my sister with insurance claims regarding her illness.  He was compassionate and kind, meeting with her and encouraging her and working hard to reach a successful settlement.

When I was in need of an attorney after being injured in a car accident, I called on Inge. It was during those months when he was working on my case that I came to know him as a resourceful, tireless advocate and also as a friend. He was always accessible whenever I had a question, always interested in how I was feeling. He was able to obtain a settlement for me that was much more than I had anticipated.

Recently, my elderly dad needed some legal advice.  Again, I sought Inge's help. He took time out of his busy day to talk to us and tell us how to proceed with the issue.

I believe these are the reasons that Inge Johnstone is an effective and successful attorney.  He is a compassionate, kind advocate who is never too busy to take the time to listen to his clients, who he treats as friends.
He then uses his considerable talents as a knowledgeable, resourceful, experienced attorney to work tirelessly to obtain the best possible judgements for his clients.

I highly recommend Johnstone Carroll for anyone who requires legal representation.

name: Brandon Esco
text: I strongly recommend Barbi Agricola and her team at Agricola Law for all of your legal needs. Barbi has the upmost integrity, intelligence, and full knowledge of the law.  She uses all of these characteristics with great passion and professionalism no matter what type case you have.  I would put her up against any attorney in the area.  I mean it, she's STRONG!!   I have consulted with Barbi on several legal questions that I have had the past few years and most recently with a divorce.  Her sharp instincts and ability to stay focused on what matters most is hands down the best around.  Barbi was always extremely responsive to my questions, was able to explain to me the options I had, give me a realistic idea of what to expect, and develop an overall strategy.  I could tell that she was well respected based on the interaction with the judge and other attorney's.  Because of her, I received the best possible outcome with my case.  I was extremely satisfied with her work and will definitely use Barbi and her staff again if the need should arise.

Even with saying that I still highly recommend Agricola Law Firm for the honesty, sincerity and preparedness.  The experience overall because of the judge and the other party was really disheartening. Too much joking when my livelihood was at risk made it awkward which is not my lawyer fault.

Had no complaints at first. Not from Alabama, never been in trouble. Never needed an attorney. Got a “drug paraphernalia” charge for a grinder/pipe 🙄 coming home from Florida vacay. They called back in a timely manner, lowered the fee of one bc we were a “package deal” in which I very appreciate HOWEVER he changed my “defendents statement” after we had already signed. Including information that was false and incorrect. He was a solid 30 minutes late for court. So after having falsified court documents, I called him to get them changed or corrected and his response was that the DA needed what the paraphernalia was so “maybe he should have ran it by us”, it didn’t matter, he couldn’t do anything, and the judge already signed off on it. Then upon exiting the court offered to walk us out just to ask for a review on Google. He was pretty easy to talk to, which was the only thing I had to really say until I saw my falsified documents.

‼️UPDATE‼️: MISUNDERSTANDING WAS CORRECTED AND BRIAN MADE SURE THE DOCUMENTS WERE CORRECTED ON BOTH ENDS AND CONTACTED ME IMMEDIATELY WITH FILED/APPROVED CORRECTIONS. I highly recommend using his services! ‼️UPDATE‼️

resp.text: Thank you Hanna. I assure you I had no intent to falsify anything. It was an honest mistake and I’m happy I could help get everything straightened out for you. Best wishes!

text: In 2012 Mr Dasinger was court appointed to me in a criminal case, I never once met with him,spoke to him, nothing until my court date. I wrote many letters, and my family made many calls to no response. The day of court, he had no idea who I was or anything about my case. All he had to say was the state is sending you to prison and to accept it cause that was my only option. I was young, scared, and had no idea what to do. He on the other hand, played on fb, laughed it up with the states attorney, and my victim. My first and only felony, poss of forged instrument, two checks for less than $50, got me 3 yrs. I got more help from the inmates sitting next to me that day than I got from him. He did NOTHING in my deffense. I do honestly believe the outcome would have been less severe if I had paid him cash, or if I had went with a diffrent lawyer. It has been many years and I do hope he has grown as a lawyer and person since then, but I would not recommend him.

resp.text: Unfortunately, when I held a contract with the State of Alabama as an appointed attorney, I did not have the time to meet with all of the 100+ new clients that I was appointed to represent each month. The numbers were simply overwhelming and impossible to keep up with.  I have not handled court appointed work since 2013 because I wanted to be able to give more personal attention to all of my clients, which I am now able to do.  I'm deeply sorry that I couldn't have helped you more Frank.  I hope all is going well and I wish you a prosperous 2019.

I have a very unusual case of questionable debt collection coming from Denmark from a debt collector located in California out of nowhere which is complicated to deal with. So many unknowns and I was unable to sleep because I felt overwhelmed on how to deal with it when I found out.

Within a few hours of making contact with Mr Watts, he sent me a few steps to take in order to get on the right path to sorting this out. Within 24 hours he called me and we discussed the way forward and we came up with a plan.

He is easy to talk to, takes the time to explain things and is very pleasant and patient. I feel a HUGE sense of relief now and very confident I have found the right person and firm to navigate my way out of this unusual situation successfully.

There are not many lawyers that will help with fighting off debt before it goes to judgement or collections. These guys are pretty much it in Alabama and they are AWESOME. This is how EVERY law firm (lets also say every business) should run a business: prompt, detailed, caring, calm, dedicated, hardworking, intelligent, effective and responsive. An absolute breath of fresh air.

I have my plan and I am ready to fight now thanks to Mr Watts!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review!  Really appreciate you!

John Watts

text:
When served with a summons in my driveway as I was getting into my car, I was a bit confused. The envelope contents naming me a co-defendant made me change gears and begin researching my options. Several legal firms sent unsolicited advertisements to my mailing address. In searching my home city for legal council I discovered that  most only handled bankruptcies. That was not the route I wanted to take. My wonderful wife found the legal firm of Watts and Herring LLC online. On the website were a number of  useful Youtube articles explaining how to handle my situation and even how to do it myself. However, the old saying about the person that represents himself in court has a fool for a lawyer rang out loudly in my brain as did a movie quote, "A man's got to know his limitations". I decided to contact Mr. John Watts.

I told my co-defendant about Mr. Watts and it was agreed to see if they would represent us. Mr. Watts assistant, Carolyn was cordial, professional and to the point. She arranged a phone conversation and Mr. Watts listened to my side and let me know about my options. None involved bankruptcy and he told me how to fill out the defendant's responses. My co-defendant agreed to be represented by Mr. Watts and the step by step procedure went as planned. It was reassuring that we were informed along the way and Carolyn was usually available to answer any questions I had either that day or the next.

Now that it is over, I am glad that Watts and Herring represented us. Most of my contact was through emails and a few conversations with Carolyn. I would tell anyone not to expect any drama and the only thing that can't be sped up is the wheels of justice. Be patient and let your legal representatives do their job. Watts & Herring did.

resp.text: Edgar thank you for your review.  We enjoyed representing you very much!  You took action which is vital -- I know I've been guilty of learning stuff but not taking action.  So congratulations to you for not only learning your rights but taking action.  Thank you again for leaving us feedback!  John Watts

name: Amy Perry
text:
I'm so grateful for the time Atty. Watts spent with me over the phone.  I could not afford to hire his firm but he gave me some vital gems to assist me with my case with Midland Funding.  The YouTube   videos were the icing on the cake.  Atty. Watts explains the processes and gives you key things to look out for so that you won't be overwhelmed with the process.

FILE A RESPONSE TO THE LAWSUIT AND SHOW UP TO COURT! (best advice ever!)

I followed the instructions--- answer the summons, show up to court and be prepared with a definitive response to the claim of debt.  I did all of that and the Judge informed the lawyer that I denied owing the debt and now she has to fulfill my Request for Production.  The lawyer stated that it was my debt because she had credit card statements.  The Judge replied, "we live in a day of identity theft and the defendant has requested that you produce a signed agreement between her and Midland Funding ---can you produce it".  The lawyer responded that she believed that she could produce the information.  Judge gave us 60 days to return back before him.

The lawyer asked if she could speak with me in the hallway and the judge suggested that I see what she had to say.  She asked me did I not received the credit card statements that were sent to me.  I stated, "I repeat my answer from court --- I have received everything that your office submitted to circuit court".  She replied, than you have everything (I remembered Atty. Watts mentioning to be cautious in your response to the lawyer because they can flip it back on you).  I reminded her that the judge asked her office to fulfill my Request for Production and she said that I will have everything in 30 days.

So I will await whatever further documentation that Midland Funding can produce.  What's amazing is that Midland Funding is projected to be removed from my credit report September 2018.  I cross referenced that with all three credit bureaus and they all notate September 2018.

Atty. Watts, I thank you so very much for everything.

resp.text: Amy you are very welcome and thank you for leaving us feedback and your story.  Wishing you all the best!  John Watts

After a year in the nightmare with creditors, I felt bankruptcy was my only option. I had hired a credit counseling service, who took my money and ran. I hired a credit clean up service, who took my money and ran. The same story repeated itself over and over. Creditors were suing me, my life Was imploding and I feared I was about to lose everything! Finally, while googling bankruptcy laws, I somehow stumbled on the name John Watts and thought, what do I have to loose? I gave it one last stitch effort. I was amazed at the amount of advice he gave! He really seemed to care! He spent ample time helping me to understand my situation and gave me several options, bankruptcy was not one of them! He even sent a packet full of information! He felt like he could make an impact on my situation and that he did! One of my  creditors was American Express. They are no longer a creditor because the debt was cancelled and is to be erased from my credit report!!! John Watts was able to accomplish this without having to step foot in the court room! One case down and one to go! I am incredibly thankful to have found John Watts! Has been so very kind and generous and has given me the peace of mind I need! It gives me hope that my credit will be back in shape soon and I won't have the cloud of bankruptcy looming over my head! If you are facing a challenging situation, I urge you to give him a call! You have nothing to lose and everything to gain! I promise you, you won't regret it! Kind, compassionate and caring are the words that describes John Watts! He loves what he does and it shows. He truly is an attorney that cares!

name: Jackie Umpleby
text: When I was first served a summons and learned that I was being sued for an old debt, I was terrified. I am a young mom and have a lot on my plate, not to mention- I have never been in any "legal" trouble before. The debt was far more than I could afford. At first, I did very little research. I tried reaching out to the debt collector directly to try and settle this. When that did not go anywhere (and it typically doesn't, they would rather not settle directly. They can get more by taking you to court.) I reached out to Ferry & Nichols. Ferry & Nichols send out the same letter to everyone in the state of Alabama that has an open case against them. They state they are a mediator and will "assist" you in "settling your debt at a much lower price". For me, it was $300 lower than the alleged debt..but with their fees I would be paying only $50 less than what I was being sued for. After a few calls to them, something was fishy. They never answered any of my questions and I spoke to multiple different people who kept telling me different things. I was not confident with hiring them. At this point I had only a few more days to respond to my summons before a default judgement was placed against me. My anxiety was through the roof. I did more extensive research and came across Watts & Herring. The videos on his website were so helpful, I called immediately. Caroline answered my call and she was so comforting..I laid it all out on the table; my problem and how fearful I was. She reassured me that Mr.John Watts could help. And he did! Not only did he give me the best possible choice, he taught me a lot! He was always a text, call, or email away. He solved my debt with this nasty debt collector better than I even expected! My total cost spent was far less than I would have guessed when I first started this process. My only regret is that I let myself worry and stress too long...I should have called the minute I found out. John is a life saver and made what could have been a very bad experience into a great one! My advise- do not make any decisions into solving your debt until you speak to John. He is an amazing and genuine person. Highly recommend this wonderful man and his office!

name: LH 97
text:
A couple of years ago my husband was served papers that he was being sued by an "infamous" debt collector. We were so upset and didn't know where to turn. We had only 14 days to file an answer to the complaint or the plaintiff would get a default judgment. I started searching on the web of how to answer the complaint, but had no idea how we were going to fight this! I didn't know where to even begin!
Then, I came across Watts & Herring, Consumer Protection Attorneys website and blog and started reading and watching videos that John Watts had posted. I started feeling much more at ease and decided we would try to fight this.
Well, before I had even submitted an answer to the complaint, a process server came again and my husband was being sued for a SECOND lawsuit by the SAME "infamous" DEBT COLLECTOR!! Now we had TWO answers to file. I felt a bit overwhelmed, but felt like I could tackle this. We WERE NOT going to let them win by a default judgment!
I turned in the answers and got notice of court dates. The court dates were exactly a week apart!
I did a lot of research and felt VERY confident on our day in court. I did have some concerns in facing a judge and not knowing what questions may be asked by the plaintiff. However, I came prepared to court, and after speaking with the attorney for the plaintiff for awhile and questioning everything that was his "evidence", he caved. We WON lawsuit number one!
The very next week we went to court for the second lawsuit, very confidently, with our heads held high, and lo and behold...the same attorney was representing the plaintiff! Again, he caved. So, WE WON AGAIN!! We had been sued TWICE by the same "infamous" debt collector and BEAT THEM both times!
Well, I had sent an email to John Watts of Watts & Herring to let him know about our success and to thank him for all of the wonderful information on his website. He congratulated us and suggested we sue the debt collector back in Federal Court. WOW! I had no idea that was an option!
Even though we succeeded in our county small claims court twice on our own, I knew we would need the expertise of John Watts for the Federal Lawsuits; there's no way we could do that on our own.
John explained our options and was very attentive with any of our concerns. He represented us in filing TWO Federal Court Cases against the debt collector that had no right to sue us.
The process went very smoothly for us. John or the knowledgeable staff at Watts & Herring kept us updated regularly throughout the whole process of any kind of progress being made on the lawsuits, and that put my mind at ease instead of worrying and feeling overwhelmed.
Both Federal Court Cases resulted in settlements that we were very pleased with. We could not have been any happier. We truly would like to thank John Watts and the staff of Watts & Herring! We could not have fought those battles alone!
So, for any of you reading this, if you're sued by a debt collector, I highly recommend Watts & Herring! Be SURE to answer any lawsuit within the deadline and do not let them win a default judgement! Try not to be overwhelmed, intimidated, or let it stress you out or give you anxiety. Seek the advice of Watts & Herring. They are very friendly and knowledgable folks and can explain your options. I know you will be pleased!

Many people don't get the chance to have options when dealing with legal issues and I am glad that there are lawyers out there that will inform as well as help you to stand up to poor collection practices and tactics. I wish that they had a larger platform to reach many others like myself whom otherwise would have to take being mistreated by the collections system. One of the most satisfying things about this whole process was to deal with someone who when they said something they meant and did it. name: Mohogany S. Prewitt
text:
As for how I felt when I was sued, It was very unsettling for both myself and my Husband. I have to admitt that I immediately went into a panicked. Although it was after 6 pm on a Friday evening, I grabbed the telephone and began to call the list of Attorney's I had Googled. My stress level shot up and I thought about taking the pills that my Doctor recomended to calm my nerves a few weeks ago, but I discovered that I had ran out.  What I did do, was make sure that I had taken my blood pressure meds. for that day. Thereafter, the entire weekend was a blur.  I could not get my mind from focusing on being sued.

Monday morning rolled around and we figured that perhaps we can try to work this out without legal counsel. I then called the number on the paperwork. The person on the other end (whom I thought represented the TJMAXX Co.)convinced me that I would be out of this mess if I paid them a lump sum or payed a sum monthly for 2 years, and signed a Concent Judgement Form. That was a chance I welcomed if it meant that we would be out from under this pressure. We considered selling my Husband's vehicle to do the settlement but decided against it( his car isn't worth much anyway). Instead, I made the first monthly payment which was money set aside for my 14 year old daughter's Curriculumn for that year. We felt uneasy about the Consent Judgement Form after we did some research on it. My Husband and I placed a stop on the check , but the bank said it had already been processed. We then decided that we will seek legal counsel because clearly, we needed it!

Tuesday morning I got a call from Mr. Watts's Secretary, Carolyn. Just speaking with her,  made me feel less anxious, but I was still not completely settled. The following day My Husband and I spoke with Mr. Watts. He took his time and explained the situation and our options. All of our questions were answered and we ended the call with the feeling of having had a black cloud literally lifted from over our heads! Although we are aware that the process is in its infancy, our anxiety level has greatly diminished!

Fast Foward to October 8, 2016:
Around 8:45 that morning we got an email from Mr. Watts stating that we won our case! We were so grateful to God and Mr.Watts and his Staff! One other thing...during the time we were waiting for the case to settle we did not receive anymore threatening comunication from the Company that we were being sued by. This made waiting for our Victory a great deal easier! We recomend Watts & Herring, LLC to all anyone who ever find themselves in such a terrible place as we did.

Sincerly,
Mr. and Mrs. Prewitt

name: Sunshine Sanders
text: I want to thank my attorney Eddie MasseyIII and the wonderful staff at Clay, Massey & Associates. My husband and I had been in Mobile county for about a year and a half before my accident and had no clue what firm would represent me fairly, so I asked around and got two recommendations. Long story short, I chose the right one. The wait was long but I’m sure it was what I was going through medical wise. It’s over now and I’m happy with the outcome, so all in all it was worth the wait. I have two special shout-outs, (1) Ms. Sally...if you get her warm friendly voice on the phone it made your day and (2) Dana...she was very efficient and I guarantee, if she’s on the case, it’ll get done....period! I hope that I don’t need them again but if I do, they will represent me. Thanks again guys.

name: Caleb Crager
text: My name is Caleb Crager.I am from Chatom AL.I was injured in an oilfield accident in Oklahoma last Halloween.Since the injury I was never fully able to recover and as time went by I wasn’t aware of the extent of my injury.In turn I suffered from a tbi.Suffering from such an injury is very difficult to explain when Drs may not be able to pinpoint or fully diagnose the actual root of the problem.I was pushed to the side by my employer and from the negligence on their part I felt is was time to seek legal assistance.I spoke with Mr. Ed Massey over the phone and I gave him a brief summary of my situation.Without hesitation he asked to set up a meeting to get more information.Mr. Ed’s concern was first and foremost my health and getting me properly treated.You will not find a more honest man that will hear you out and truly believe in you and what you have to say.Since my employer was out of Texas I would have to find an attorney from that state.Regardless of that Mr. Ed knowing he had nothing to gain from my case has stood by my side and he was able to find me an attorney to take my case.I know Ed and his son would be there for me day or night to assist me anyway they could.My experience with Ed and his son could not have been more professional.I’m thankful to have the privilege to have met Ed and his son Eddie.They were absolutely wonderful.

name: Leiana Polwart
text:
My husband was in a car accident and the other driver’s insurance was hesitant on helping us. They kept giving us the run around and saying “they were investigating”. We googled for accident lawyers near us and Mr Massey was one of the first to pop up. We gave them a call and they saw us the very next day. They were really quick with starting the case and keeping us informed with the progress.
Unfortunately, we were dealing with a shady insurance company who kept dragging out the case as much as they could. It took a couple of months from start to finish but we got our car fixed & my husbands doctor bills paid for. All we had to do was sign a few papers and Mr Massey literally took care of everything for us.
Mr Massey was very persistent with the shady insurance company and his legal assistant Dana was always extremely quick to respond to our questions when we emailed.
If you are looking for quick action, from an excellent family oriented firm, then I would absolutely recommend Clay, Massey & Associates.

name: Simon Porter
text: I don’t have a massive amount of experience with attorney’s, but I can say that for me personally, there is no one that I would rather use than Vince Pentacost and his office. There were many things that Vince was able to do for me and my case, but what makes Vince the best attorney in our state is that he genuinely cares about his clients. Like I said, I don’t have experience with other attorneys, but I would imagine finding one that I know cares about me and my well being is rare. I wish that there were better words that I could use to explain how great this attorney is. He is a man that I respect and although I hope I never need an attorney again, if I do it will be Vince Pentacost that I call. Also, Vince’s office staff, Amber, is one of the most amazing people I know!! If you are in need of representation, I’m telling you that they are the best hands down.

name: Kimberly Patton
text:
Mr. Pentecost told me he could help get my friend of 25 years home before the end of the year because he got picked up on new charges so after talking with another lawyer from Gadsden right before who said they would have helped, but Vincent quoted me 500$ cheaper and I was told he was a Great lawyer in Gadsden right now and my friend wanted him as his lawyer so we picked him. I told him that he needed to talk with my friend because I didn’t have no clue exactly what all he had going on in another state that had him on probation here. He said he would video call him to find out exactly what his background was to better understand the case. HE NEVER did a Skype call like he told his mother and I he would do. Every time I came into pay my hard earned money being a single mother, trusting he would be this great attorney. He agreed that he would get him home for me so I wanted to pay him off ASAP so he could get to doing what he needed too.  He made 1 phone call to his P.O.  When court came, I couldn’t believe how awful it went! To the fact I literally had to stand up and address the Judge that 2 charges was already dropped so he didn’t even discuss anything with the DEA like a great lawyer should have done. I could have went to jail for reminding the lawyer in front of the whole court that these charges shouldn’t even have showed up because I personally went down to the city to make sure those charges wouldn’t show up. (I Politely stood up addressing the Judge and sat back down because he kept asking about something he should have already been told by a great lawyer) After court, he actually said to his mother that we should just let GA. come get him and feed him!! We
all know that Gadsden is completely broke right now from our past crooked sheriff is the rumors.  I was in SHOCK!! He told me exactly what I wanted to hear, that he would have him out before the end of the year! His mother went to talk to him yesterday, clearly upset because he didn’t do anything he had said he would do and his mother called me saying he actually said I lied about information with Ga. like it was all my fault because HE is always so busy, he didn’t even have a talk with him about ANYTHING. 1,500$ that I put up, when I could have went with another lawyer who I’ve worked with before and I know he would have did so much more and actually CARE about the situation instead of going in like a deer in headlights. I’m so disappointed that a lawyer I paid really quick because I wanted him happy actually. He blamed me saying a lied when I take great responsibility about how honest I actually am, when really he wasn’t prepared nor negotiated any kind of deal like we actually talked about AT ALL!!! He is so busy apparently he didn’t even care to try and fight for us as his clients. So, when finally telling his sister/secretary the whole story today she actually was smiling while I was telling her literally shaking and crying because I couldn’t believe Vincent blamed me for him not going to talk to his client in jail to find out more on the case to even be prepared.  Then actually even said to my friends mother yesterday that he wouldn’t have took the case?!? Then WHY did he? I could have went to the other lawyer that helped me on my brothers case and Millican would have talked to everyone before court knowing what exactly could be done. I feel like all my hard earned money was just took and then he actually blamed me for himself not even being prepared. Then his sister had the audacity to smile and about laugh at me crying explaining that is why we kept wondering why he NEVER went and spoke with my friend about his Ga. probation that got moved to Alabama because he moved back home. I’ve heard of people getting dunks, (whatever that means) if they’ve never had one and going into community corrections. We had a whole plan for a rehab to pick him up from court. He NEVER mentioned that to the Judge. I’m so upset with how I was treated. I still have NO clue as to what is happening now but I hope no one ever gets treated like I was today. 😭

resp.text:
Eric K. Roberts was awarded the Client Champion's award in 2017, 2018, and 2019. The Client Champion award recognizes attorneys who "excel at service" to clients. Furthermore, Eric K. Roberts was awarded America's Most Honored Professionals Award in 2018 and 2019.  Eric K. Roberts has been selected as a member of the National Trial Lawyer's Top 100 Attorneys during 2017, 2018, and 2019. Since 2016, Eric K. Roberts has been selected as a member of the National Black Trial Lawyer's Top 100 Attorney in the United States of America.  Locally, Eric K. Roberts has received the Black Owned Business Award (Best Lawyer) in 2017 and 2018. These are a few of the awards that Eric K. Roberts has received while practicing law.
While in law school, Eric K. Roberts started a Civil Rights Organization while at the University of Alabama School of Law. The University of Alabama School of Law is ranked within the top 25 law schools in the nation by US News.  He also received the Order of the Samaritan for his charity work within the community.  Furthermore, while in law school, Eric K. Roberts received the Dean's Community Service Award.
Eric K. Roberts has possessed a Doctor of Theology degree from a Seminary for more than a decade.
Due to the ethical natures surrounding this individual, I have been instructed not to provide the actual issues or facts surrounding this matter.  I can clearly provide that this review does not accurately reflect the interactions pertaining to this individual.
This office has an open-door policy. The vast majority of Eric K. Roberts' clients are provided with his personal e-mail address and personal cell phone number. Eric K. Roberts receives and communicates with many clients via text message.
Once again, due to ethical restraints, I am unable to provide the public with the nature of this post.  However, Eric K. Roberts would like to take this opportunity to thank all of his former clients, which includes, Asians, African-Americans, Caucasians, and other ethnicities, who have supported his minority-owned business for almost two decades.

name: Lori Norris
text:
Hi, I’m Lori Norris. My brother, Jeremy Jerry  was charged with capitol murder charges. Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone Attorneys took his case. They are father and son.
Right from the start they were friendly and professional. They got my brother to be evaluated at Taylor Hardin Secured Medical Center. That is a much nicer place with someone with a mental illness. You got to visit for 2 hrs on the weekends in person. He was going to stay there til his trial. He had several competency hearings. He wasn’t competent. His trial was set for May. We were all grieving and sad. I love my brother no matter what. Then in April I got a call his trial was canceled. He failed his last competency test. I was happy. My brother Jeremy Jerry was going to live in a group home for the rest of his life. With competency hearings every 6 months. He could live somewhat of a life.♥️🙏

If you didn’t read anything else. Dani V. and Sam Bone are great, kind and friendly attorneys. They are professional and work hard to get the job done. They are kind and friendly but they also kick butt! I never thought this would be possible! I am grateful for them the rest of my life. Thank you Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone. I will come to you if I need an attorney in the future for sure.

Lori Norris

name: Kathy Johnson
text: Divorce is HARD no matter if you want it or not, I don't wish it on anyone. When I was faced with mine in 2019, I was referred to Dani Bone through a coworker and friend that I trusted. I initially hired Dani because I heard he was the very best and he would fight for me. I called and even though they were extremely busy, they saw me right away. After hearing my situation, Dani was honest with me and said, "You need Sam. " My case was very complicated having both personal and business issues, assets and properties to divide, custody and other court issues . Sam took it as a challenge. He stayed with me and guided me through the whole divorce process. It was not easy, it was extremely tough but Sam knew how to handle every situation that came up. When going through a 2 yr battle, you need to know and  feel confident that your attorney has your back and has your best interest at heart. I emotionally fell apart many times and he helped me to learn to stand up for myself and it made me a stronger person through this process. All I wanted was what was fair- he got me exactly what I asked for! I was extremly pleased with services of Sam, Dani and their dedicated and caring staff. Amanda, Fredrick and Osha were just wonderful to work with. The whole staff made me feel comfortable and at ease through a very uncomfortable life circumstance.  While the other party had 5 attorneys through the process , I had one.  I only needed the one team- I had The Best with Sam & Dani Bone. Sam was honest, upfront, bold and encouraging. He never had to be ugly or raise his voice in court or trial and never once belittled anyone. I recall him saying, "It doesn't have to be ugly". Being a Christian, a professional, a self employed woman, a Realtor and a mother of 2, this was imperative to me. Sam treated both parties with total RESPECT always . That was very important to me.  I did my part and provided the true facts, evidence and proof- he did his part and presented my case with true professionalism , Integrity and no one was disrespected in the process. I would 💯 percent recommend Sam & Dani Bone if you want to be represented by someone who will always have your back and is not afraid to fight for your best interest. Thank you Sam, Dani, and your amazing team. If I ever need attorney services in the future , I will use you again and will highly recommend you to anyone that I know. You Rock!

name: Bernadette Wineman
text:
Earlier this year, I found myself in need of a divorce attorney when my ex petitioned to modify our final judgment. I no longer lived in Alabama and was unsure of where to turn for legal advice. After consulting with Mr. Sam Bone, it was clear that he had a deep understanding of law and how it applied to my particular situation.

Many attorneys will promise the moon, without being able to deliver a star. Sam will be honest about your case, talk with you about the possibilities, and develop a plan to protect your best interests. Phone calls/emails are answered promptly and you are made aware of appointments and court actions. Even though my case was regular family law issues, it was treated as a priority.

When emotions run high and people play dirty, you need an attorney that will keep you focused. It was nothing short of a blessing to have Sam’s counsel during this time. Sam will listen and use what will benefit your case most, helping you to make the best decisions.

Through my experience, I learned that Sam is wise beyond his years and holds a unique combination of qualities that make him an excellent attorney. He is a younger lawyer in comparison to many of the veterans in the area, but his expertise speaks through shrewd discernment, both in and outside the courtroom.

In retrospect, I know that employing a professional, well-versed attorney who gave honest legal advice was a valuable asset to me. My case only involved family law, but I would recommend Sam Bone in every area that he practices. My children and I are thankful for the Bone Law Firm.

name: Fred Sherron
text: Sam Bone is well on his way to being the very best Gadsden criminal lawyer.  I had caught a case for distribution that held a two to twenty year prison incarceration.  Sam was able to get me pre-trial diversion due to it being my first felony.  He and Dani are just awesome supportive guys.  I was in bad shape recovering from cancer and kidney failure when I was arrested.  They made me feel like I had nothing to worry about.  They treated me with respect even knowing I was homosexual and you do not get that in a lot of offices or businesses in Gadsden.  Sam is a winner guys.  He will go out of his way to help and set up a payment arrangement for you.  I could not have had a better Gadsden criminal lawyer.  Sam knows the laws.  Everytime I see him he tells me he is proud for me to see how well I am doing.  I am going for my degree in psychology and further to a doctrine.  I might be sixty by the time I finish but that's what life is about.  I am proud to say Sam Bone is my lawyer.

resp.text: Thank you, Fred.  We really appreciate your kindness

We were shocked to learn all the products he was exposed to in his electrical construction career could have caused his cancer. They helped us through the preliminary interview and we are confident he will receive settlements we he justifiably deserves. Dee Vitale

resp.text: We call everyone back, it takes a long time we know. Hang in there your claim was expedited and is in the queue with the asbestos trust funds.

name: Sherry Sharp
text:
I opened my deceased father's estate on the advice of ELG in order to receive benefits from his asbestosis claim I mailed them letters testamentary. I called ELG on a regular basis to check on status of claim. I was always told that there was an estate issue. Now, time has run out because my fathers estate has been closed, and ELG has claimed the right to administer the estate ad litem, and the processing of the estate has moved from Jefferson to Baldwin County.

I should have never spent the money, which I need, to open my dad's estate only to be ignored long enough for his estate to be closed. Seems there is no way to win with this group without paying/losing more money. My father would be so saddened to know that these benefits are not available to me. He died 3 1/2 years, and I have done all the right things, according to ELG. I guess if they ignore cases long enough, then they can step in, claim that there is no family representative, and take their cut. I think it is a racket.

resp.text: Hello Mrs Sharp,  I see payment is being processed by the asbestos trust funds. Please be patient we are close, we just need to wait for them to process the entire once and for all. Bare with us.

name: woolrose
text:
I am 70 years old and have never, until recently, sought the assistance of an attorney (except for developing a will or to review contracts before I signed) . I asked a relative, who used to work with the court system, to suggest a good law firm. My relative stated if I wanted an Honest and Reliable firm, I should contact Barfoot and Schoettker.

After making an appointment, I met with their associate, Jase Sayre and provided him with the paperwork. We discussed my case and Jase  explained all aspects of the procedure in detail. While working my case he kept me informed of the progress. He fully explained the options available to us and allowed me to chose which avenue I though best.
The result was he recovered a very significant amount (the full amount) of money owed to me.

I highly recommend the Barfoot and Schoettker Law firm. My case was solved in a quick and extremely efficient manner. The costs were very reasonable (no padding the books or intentional delays as I have heard that some law firms do). The interaction was always professional while also being personable and productive. Thank you Jase for your hard work and honest work ethic.

name: David Peel
text: Very pleased with the legal service provided by Ben Schoettker,. His genuine care and concern for his clients is a much-appreciated bonus. Would definitely recommend this firm.

name: Joan Beasley
text:
I highly recommend Barfoot & Schottker over all others.

With only a few months left before the two year deadline of my case, I contacted this firm to consider my case. (The attorney I initially hired had unexpectedly retired.)  Barfoot & Schoettker agreed to take my case even though they were working against a close deadline.

I was impressed with their care and compassion, close straight forward communication, integrity, diligence and professionalism. Jase and Kay  were diligent in keeping me informed about the case and including me in decisions that had to be made.

Overall it was a vey positive experience, and I would not hesitate to use them again.

name: Vicki Ricke
text: Jim has been my attorney since 2015 and has been a huge asset to not only my family but to our business as well. I cannot say enough about him and his abilities. He was referred to me by another attorney which in itself speaks volumes. Pino & Associates will be our law firm for all our business and personal needs!

name: Tara Davenport
text:
In December 2015 Jim Pino was referred to me by a family friend, also an attorney and who’s advice and opinion matter greatly to me.

I needed an attorney who would fight for me. To help and advise me with a divorce after 23 years of marriage. I knew going into it that it wasn’t going to be anywhere close to pretty, much less easy for a multitude of reasons. But I also knew that I had “hit my wall” and it was necessary. I also knew that I was going to have to have an attorney that would work with me, not just for me. I had been married since I was 21.... nothing about anything was easy and I was terrified about everything.

And that’s exactly what Jim did for me.

Jim and his amazing staff helped me through one of the hardest times of my life and helped me find myself again.

I would and do, recommend Jim Pino & Associates to any and everyone who asks.

Thank you Jim and thank you to your awesome staff!!

name: Gordon Madden
text: There is not enough space to share my experience with Jim and the entire staff. They have worked with me for over a decade (11) years. Almost daily, many nights, weekends even when they've been on vacation. Never once failing to jump up to the emergency, or simply to make sure my son was protected. Because of Jim and his family, staff and associates, I have been given the opportunity to have a wonderful relationship with my little boy. He's stood in my defense against 17 different lawyers, sometimes 5 against 1. His son has stood with me as well. We've had multiple trials, most recently he postponed major surgery and suffered through a 4 day trial. Agonizing in Pain against 4 very reputable lawyers. Not to mention, he did this for 1/5 of the money the other guys were being paid. He did it because he cares and felt that it was in my son's best interest and we'll being. Just today, our order was issued. Once again, his hard work and character and one of a kind skill prevailed. I still have sole custody and I am assured a meaningful relationship with the most important thing in my life. I can never repay Jim for his decade long dedication to making sure we're protected. If you need help, a brief visit with him will reveal the true character and heart he puts into making sure justice prevails. My name is Gordon Madden and I would be happy to share my story with you.

name: Jeremy Naish
text: Mr. Pino went above and beyond to help me. He explained everything very thoroughly and let me know what to expect. He was honest and gave me options. I have used Mr. Pino on a few occasions with success every time. I highly recommend using Mr.Pino.
