name: simin wong (DOCTOR)
text:
In 2015, two years after my husband passed away, after reaching out to quite a few law firms who could not help me with my case, I was told by a senior colleague to contact Hare, Wynn, and Newell & Newton – Birmingham. It was there when I had the great fortune to have Attorney James R. Moncus III as my lawyer after he accepted my case.
Based on my experience/evidence, and outcomes of my case, I got to know James R. Moncus. He had all the attributes of not only a lawyer, but a great leader. He had excellent ethical, technical, and business skills obtained through many years working on many complicated cases. He was energetic, very seasoned, extremely graceful, and most importantly, exceptionally, and “I really mean exceptionally” caring, with amazing capability to recognize his clients’, his opponents’, and other people's emotions and needs to plan and set a foundation for success of my case. He tirelessly and effortlessly brought people together to share ideas and best solution with remarkable consciousness and deep concern for my wellbeing, and the success of my case. And this is what, and  how I really know Attorney Jamie Moncus of Hare, Wynn, Newell & Newton of Birmingham.
This firm and most importantly, Attorney Jamie Moncus have a “get the job done” mentality in their approach to business of any of their clients. Attorney Moncus is not only a very capable lawyer, but a “Top Notch Protector” of his clients’ rights. His extensive background in problem solving, his communication skills, his leadership style, and being remarkably emotionally intelligent, sets him apart from most, and I can confidently say from all other lawyers with respect to practice of law, client relationship development and communication, and negotiation talent. He brings a unique enthusiasm to each engagement balanced with a structured, plan-oriented approach that sets a foundation for miraculous outcome. Jamie Moncus is a committed and devoted lawyer. He also possess an affable personality which puts his clients, his opponents, his team at ease in working with him even on the most complicates cases.
I very strongly recommend Hare, Wynn, Newell & Newton of Birmingham and Attorney Jamie Moncus to anyone, including my own family members, my professional colleagues, and my friends, who may need an effective, high energy, compassionate, graceful law firm to take on any case, large or small. They are highly professional with a natural ability to develop best strategies, and reaching out to all to solve the most difficult problems with grace and integrity. They are and remain to be what we the people need: A stellar law firm with a high moral and ethical standard, a real wonderful American, a dispensable asset to our community and our country.

Thank you.
Godspeeds Attorney James R. Moncus III- Hare, Wynn, Newell & Newton – Birmingham

Simin S. Wong, M.P.H., Ph.D.
Community Medicine Senior Research Scientist
Walter McDonald Associates

name: Cindy-Rae Jones
text: Deepti Asthana has been our attorney since 2014. In the span of only four years, she has untangled three complicated estates which overlapped one another as the decedents were also one another's heirs.  Her counsel has been very helpful to both our dying family members and to those of us left behind. Dee processes all the legal twists and turns of an issue and  straightens it all out to protect the interests and liabilities of the decedents, their heirs and the estate representatives. As the trustee to one estate, executor to another, and administrator & realtor for the other estate, I have had to rely heavily on Dee's continued counsel and guidance, which has been impeccable. Staying on top of complex matters, while grieving the loss of family members, can get tricky and overwhelming at times, and important documents can be missed. But with Dee's wonderful paralegal, Debbie, always on top of everything, I never worry that I will make a mistake that will injure someone. Debbie calls and texts me when I need to sign documents or pay expenses, and she keeps me and the process up-to-date and always moving forward to closure. These two women have guided and walked our family through the most complex time of our lives, and I recommend them to everyone I know who needs a really sharp estate attorney with a smart, on-the-ball paralegal. I must add that if there is a time you need an attorney to fight for you, if you don't choose these ladies, just pray that the entity you need protection from hasn't chosen them.  As nice as they are, when it comes to protecting their clients, they don't play.

name: grayson jones
text: As an Intern at Reid Law Firm I get to witness everything that goes on at the firm. Chris Reid goes above and beyond not only for his clients but for his interns as well. His passion and care for helping others is second to none. He is always teaching us interns things and shows us how he implements them on cases and life experiences. Recently, at the firm we have been working a case for a local veteran battling Cystic Fibrosis, who’s father just died and was falsely declared dead by social security. So not only was this client dealing with battling for his life, he has been mentally drained from this mistake that was made by Social Security and the recent death of his father. In roughly a week with Reid Law Firm working on the case we have been able to get a senator Doug Jones, congressman Gary Palmer, and the white house involved to help expedite this case so he can get his health insurance and accounts unfroze. This has been an incredible experience working on a case getting to make such a huge difference in someone’s life.

resp.text: Thanks Grayson, I couldn't have solved the Nuss case without your help. You represent the best and brightest of your generation. If I can ever help let me know

Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue. We’re so sorry for the loss of your mother. There are many reasons why a case may take longer than one expect; however, we take pride in keeping our clients informed throughout the legal process. We’d like to make things right.

Unfortunately, we have not been able to locate you in our database, and therefore, we are unable to directly contact you. Do you, by chance, have us confused with another law firm, or do you go by another name? We would like to speak with you offline, because we would not want your case harmed in any way by releasing confidential information in such a public forum.

Please feel free to get in touch by calling (877) 562-0000. We'd be happy to discuss the case at your earliest convenience.

text: My wife filled a suite with this attorney several years ago. They have done nothing but deceive and lie ever since. From day one she has asked them several times if the suit they were filing was a class action suit. They kept telling her no. Well, they were not lying completely however they lead her to believe they were filing the suit only on her behalf. When, in actuality it was an ultra-massive tort suit. None of this is what really upsets me, what upsets me is that from day one they have lead her believe that she is going to receive a minimum of $2,000,000. I have done several hours of research getting the background on the lawsuits filed for the same reason she filed hers. First off I have not even seen the name Cory Watson Attorneys mentioned in any of the reports. Secondly there appears to be over 10,000 people file suite for the same exact reason, against the same exact company, with several law firms. The litigation for this particular devise has been going on for many years. And, it would appear by all indications she will probably never be paid one penny. To this day, they never contact her, if she contacts them they tell her they expect some kind of payout soon, and they are still insisting that it will be $2,000,000+ Why would they cntinue to lie to her? What possible benifit would they get out of it?

text: My Mother had an asbestos lawsuit and was receiving checks monthly off the settlement, until she passed away on 01/10/2016 this was supposed to be a beneficiary settlement meaning my father was supposed to still receive the monthly settlement checks they just stopped coming!! My father called and they told him to mail her death certificate and they’d settle with him .... that’s been 2 + years ago and he has not received a dime. ! I called today and felt I received a runaround excuse that there waiting on more funds to come in ! My mother would still be here if it were not for Valley Products and there asbestos product ( car gaskets ) ! My father deserves this settlement he lives month to month and money doesn’t compensate for losing my mom but it would ease my dads financial burden after the loss of my mom !

The day of court I was a nervous wreck but Renee gave me a hug and told me everything was going to be alright. I never felt like she just "wanted" my money and that was it, like most attorneys are. She definitely has a heart for what she does. It has taken us almost a whole year for all of this to be finalized. Not on her behalf but the court/Covid-19. The ending result was more than what I was expecting! She won our case! She fought extremely hard for my kids and I. She always listened to my concerns and anytime I needed to speak to someone the ladies in the office including Renee were always so quick to get back with me. name: Mike McLarty
text:
After a lifetime of hard work in blue collar jobs I was suddenly laid off due to my heart going bad. I found myself unemployed and, sadly, unemployable at the age of 44 and with four children, one of which is severely disabled and will require lifetime care.

Ms. Thiry had helped a friend get her Disability Benefits and me, not knowing anything about how to find a lawyer for myself, contacted Ms. Thiry to discuss my case.

I was totally lost, despondent. I felt like my life was over. The shame of not being able to provide for my family was crippling. I began to look into how my family would be provided for if I passed. It was bad.

From the onset Renee was very compassionate and beyond helpful, as was her entire staff. Anytime I had a question it was answered quickly. She explained the process to me, was honest about the time it would take, and the difficulties of my case because of my age.

Looking back, I think it was her hope and encouragement that sustained me, because I had none of my own.

I was awarded Full Disability, and my back pay was set six entire months before I thought it would be. I don't know how that happened, but I am grateful to Ms. Thiry for making it so.

I have my life back now and, with whatever time I have left I can concentrate on making quality memories with my children. That would not be the case if not for Ms. Thiry's considerable attention to my claim and the dedication of her staff.

I consider her a family friend now and highly recommend her. Were it not for her keen legal mind, good heart, and professionalism I have no idea where I would be now, or if I even would be.

From the bottom of my (malfunctioning) heart, thank you Renee Thiry. You were my angel when me and my family needed one the most.

text: I don’t usually write reviews but I have to in this case. I needed an lawyer back in November 2010 after I was involved in a car accident on my job. The legal process was easy and stress free, I was very informed throughout the whole process by Mr. Richard and his team, and I felt at ease asking any questions I had. Richard Thiry was very diligent and got me a settlement quickly. Fast forwarding on June 14,2018 I was again involved in another car accident on the job after only been employed 2 days. I immediately reach out to THIRY & CADDELL, LLP. Mr. Richard no longer practice law because he had retired but his daughter Renee Thiry also is a lawyer there.  First, I'd like to say THANK YOU to Renee Thiry and the staff. They are very professional, personable and very helpful team.  Renee always keeps her word and came through for me when I needed her most. I hired Renee for my workers comp and personal injury suit.  Renee always made me feel that she had things under control and was on top of the case. My job terminate me after 7 months because of permeant injury due to the car accident. She help me get my unemployment to help me out until my case was settle. As a single mom with two kids it help out A LOT. My workers comp case has now been settled and i am so relieved and will be forever grateful. I know that she is also going to do a great job with my personal injury case as well. I honestly don't know what I would do without them. If you want the best then you definitely want to hire Renee Thiry.  I cannot thank her enough for all she is doing for me. I don't believe any lawyer could have done any better, that's why I truly believe they are the Best!!!!

name: Ari Miller
text: By far, the best, most knowledgeable, and effective attorney in the region. He does not sugar coat. He does not give best case scenario. He is honest and very accurate in his assessment of situations. He is highly regarded among his peers, opponents, and judges, and he fights the right fights. If you want an attorney that will promise you the world, take your money, and fail, he's not your guy. But, if you want someone who understands the complexities of human behavior, the law, and how to best represent his clients, Joel is the one. Do not waste time or money anywhere else. Joel's clients always achieve the best possible outcomes. Always. I recommend him unconditionally. But when you see him, be honest, don't expect him to coddle you and make you feel warm and gooey about yourself, and then just trust him to handle things. That's it.

name: Deborah Pryce
text: Overall, not a very good experience at all. This attorney will talk up a good game at the initial consultation, then will subsequently reveal that is not even on your side, which is the very least one ought to expect from a defense attorney. Don't expect him to actually remember anything about your case, because he never takes notes and seems to have terrible comprehension skills. I would describe him as incompetent, but it actually seemed worse than incompetence: he didn't believe me and he was deferring to the prosecutor's (his opponent) side. Though there clearly was some incompetence at play. Mr. Sogol told me that if I got into a pre-trial diversion program that my record would be expunged after completing it. However, I looked it up and the alleged offense for which I was arrested CANNOT be expunged under Alabama law, though I plan to litigate that issue when the time is right. If you want an attorney who will make a serious effort to learn about the intricacies of your case, I highly advise you to look elsewhere.

He didn't give me any legal advice because it "would have to be a case", I understood that. I don't want to waste my time or anybody else time. He was rude, he kept cutting me off with "what's your question?" Well, I dont know thats why im calling someone like you with your expertise! I am not looking to sue unless I have a case which is why I called. There are other lawyers who would give you advice without suing outside of legal aid.
However, he did refer me to legal aid, after the fact I suggested legal aid because it's FREE to receive legal advice. That was by far the best advice he could give me being that Legal aid has helped and guided me through cases before which led me to winning cases on my own, or cases being dropped. If you do not receive the advice you need with any law group(s) I would suggest Legal Aid. Legal Aid response is much quicker. Also, legal aid will listen. They will make sure they are guiding you in the right direction. Depending who you talk to, they're blunt too but they WILL help you!

Even after negotiating a plea deal that I never dreamed possible, he still went back AGAIN and laid my story out – showing how I had turned my life around – and getting me an even better deal than before. name: Billy L Billings Jr
text:
My dad passed away intestate and has a house in Alabama. I live in Orlando, FL and was trying to find an attorney in Alabama to assist me with his affairs there. So, I found Attorney Pierce online and reached out to him. His staff was very nice and very pleasant on the phone.

During my phone consultation with Attorney Pierce, he was equally as nice and very personable. He asked me some questions about the circumstances and was very attentive.

Finally, what really impressed me about him was that once he realized that my dad's house was not close to where he typically practices; he advised me that I would most likely be better served to consult an attorney that was closer to my dad's house. He said that he could handle the case; however, it would become more expensive because that area is approximately 4 hours from him. In my opinion, most people wouldn't even care about that. They would only care about running the bill up on you. In addition to that, he even found and referred me to an attorney in that area that could assist me.

I certainly appreciate his honesty and his assistance. I wish that I could've had that opportunity to work with him in my time of need. Take care, Attorney Pierce, and thank you very much. It was truly a pleasure.

resp.text: Thank you so much! I really appreciate the kind words. Our goal is always to try to help folks the best we can, even if that means sending them to friends who may be a better fit for the case based on the facts or location. I hope things are always well for you in Orlando. -KDP

name: Alan Richards
text:
Did a great job for me after a DUI....
I have never had the need for a criminal defense lawyer – until I did!  I hired Mr. Russell Crumbley based on two recommendations from persons who work in the legal business.  Now, I am the one recommending Russ and his team at Crumbley-Blackwell & Associates to anyone reading this.  Just hours after my arrest, I was able to make an appointment before my first visit to the court.  Having never been in this situation before, this was very important to me.  Russ was with me every step of the way.  In the end, my case was dismissed thanks to this fine law firm.
There were many court appearances, so I was able to observe his interactions with other defense lawyers, prosecutors, and two judges.  It was obvious to me that he is well liked and, more importantly, well respected in the legal community.  It takes more than just navigating the legal system (which Russ did with ease), it also takes relationships.
Again, I highly recommend Mr. Crumbley and will never forget what he did for me.

resp.text: Thank you, so much, Alan for those kind words. It was a privilege to represent you and I am really glad it worked out for you. It was quite stressful for you but it is behind you now. Best wishes for you moving forward. ~ Russell

name: Christopher Fitzgibbon
text:
Chris F.

I was arrested nearly 2 years after a bar fight for felony assault, had never been arrested before and both a family friend and the bail bondsman recommended Crumbley-Blackwell. I hired Mr. Crumbley as my lawyer and he did everything he could. They tried to get me to take a plea for a misdemeanor and 2 years probation and Mr. Crumbley easily could of just told me to take it, as he was already paid and could of dumped me off and move on, but he insisted we take it to trial because he thought wasn't right what was happening and i never should of been arrested or charged for defending myself when I was attacked. He believed we could win and so I went with his advice. In the end right before the trial he got all charges dismissed and even court fees waived and I just had to pay a small restitution fee. Hiring Mr. Crumbley was the best decision I could have made and am extremely thankful to him and his firm for everything. Hopefully I never have any use for him again but if I'm ever in a bad way again he'll definitely be my first call.

resp.text: Chris: I felt strongly about your case. I hated you had to go through what you did. It took guts on your part so kudos to you, sir. You stood strong. I just stood beside you. Be blessed! ~ Russell

name: JW Wryta
text: I am a male 37 year old honor discharged protected veteran who holds a Masters Degree and has never had any issues with the law prior to my DUI in 2017.  While my charges were from 2017, I was not arrested until 2019 because I was sent to the hospital on the date of the offense instead of jail and diagnosed with Sudden Traumatic Shock exasperated by alcohol.  Being arrested was completely out of the norm for me.  I did not know where to begin, what to expect, and was consistently imagining the worst possible outcomes and scenarios.  Based off my charges, my bail agent highly recommended that I contact Mr. Crumbly for counsel.  I had an initial meeting with Mr. Crumbly within a week from the first time I contacted him.  The initial meeting did not take longer then an hour and during that time Mr. Crumbly was able to explain all my available options to include representation options, payment options, court expectations, and expected timelines.  Perhaps the most beneficial thing Mr. Crumbly discussed in the initial meeting was the overall stress of the situation.  He told me that it was human nature to imagine the worst possible outcomes and to not worry about that as it was him and his teams job to make sure those outcomes don’t happen.  He was absolutely right and ,during the entire course of my case, I constantly imagined the worst possible scenarios; however, I always made myself think back to that initial conversation with Mr. Crumbly and remembered that is why he is there.  After that initial meeting, Mr. Crumbly and his team handled everything for 6 months up until my court date with the Judge.  Before I even had to go before the Judge, Mr. Crumbly had secured a deal with the DA for me to enter the Pre-Trial Intervention Program (PTIP) and have charges dropped following the completion of the program.  I was more than happy to enter PTIP as it took all uncertainty and stress off the table and I was able to hold everything going forward in my own hands.  As of May 2020, I have successfully completed the PTIP program and am currently working with Mr. Crumbly on having my charges expunged.  I am very pleased with the services I have received from Mr. Crumbly and his team and would highly recommend them.  While I am not going to put personal information on here for obvious reasons, Mr. Crumbly has my full permission to give my number to prospective clients who would like a recommendation.

text: Mr. Crumbley is a professional in this business and highly experienced. He always strives and pushes for the best possible outcome which is something you want. Highly recommend.

name: John Doe
text: I got pulled over with a small amount of marijuana in rural Alabama. I was issued a citation for Possession of marijuana in the 2nd degree and not arrested. Attorney Crumbley and his team were able to get this citation dismissed within about 5 months, and I never even had to go to court. I simply had to pay court fees and attorney fees, which were well worth the outcome. Everything was handled in a timely manner, and my calls were always returned within 24 hours. The fact that I did not even have to go to court, or plead guilty, for a marijuana charge in rural Alabama is a miracle. Mr. Crumbley is a legal Wizard and is very professional.

resp.text: It was a pleasure working with you "John Doe". And, for others reading this, these cases obviously don't always go quite THIS well. It was a great outcome for us both. In either event, best luck to you moving forward as you work toward making your future great! I know you will. ~ Russell

name: Ruth Ridley
text: Mr Crumbley did a wonderful job for me. The court appointed lawyer told me i didn't have a chance and that I should just plead guilty and try to get probation. Mr. Crumbley met me in court to ask to continue the case so to have time to prepare. The judge refused and we had to go to trial immediately. His cross examination of the arresting officer and plaintiff was brilliant. The judge's verdict was NOT GUILTY! I recommend Russell Crumbley because he's the best.

resp.text: Sometimes, EXPERIENCE is the only weapon you have. When backed into a corner you can't really have "too much" of that. Experience always matters but in a situation like yours it can truly make all the difference. I have been there 1000's of times. You haven't. I commend your courage and cool under those circumstances. Congratulations on your victory and thank you for giving me the chance to fight that fight for you. And, thank you very much for those kind words!

name: John Everett
text: I never write reviews online, but Mr. Crumbley, his associates and staff have gone above and beyond for my case. Being arrested is a nightmare, but having these folks in my corner made the whole process seem simple and worry-free. This speaks not only to their legal wherewithal -- but also to their willingness to listen and answer questions that might not matter in the long run, but are important to you and your own piece of mind. Right from the get-go, Mr. Crumbley moved aggressively to have my case thrown out, which was ultimately successful! I have no reservations fully recommending this firm to anyone up against a criminal charge. I got the best outcome possible. Thanks Russ!

resp.text: Well THANK YOU, John, for taking a moment to share your experience! It matters to us and it matters to others who are considering who to hire as their legal team. We appreciated the opportunity to help you with your most important issues. ~ Russell

text: If you need a really good criminal defense lawyer ,hire these guys . name: Kelley Denson
text: I don't even know where to begin.  Russell is not only an attorney, he is a friend.  He takes his work very seriously, and has a huge heart that most attorneys just make you feel like a number and only care about your money, but he is not at all that way.  He really cares about his clients,and appreciates each and every one.  There is no one that I know that has the heart and knowledge of law that he does. He is genuine, kind, ambitious and most of all caring.  He is a family man with kids, and he knows how important it is that he takes care of you.  My words are only from my heart about this man.  You have to give him a chance to understand for yourself that what I say about him is nothing but honest and loyal.  But I do want and need to add something to my review about Russell..he is not only caring, ambitious, and knowledgeable, he is also very direct, will always be truthful to you and you need to be truthful with him.  He can not help you if you are not.  He is humble and kind...but he can not help if you will not open up to him, because how can he help you if you are not giving your all to him.  I recommend Russell to everyone that I run in to.  He has helped me in the past and God knows he has helped my son in the past.  My son would be in prison if it weren't for Russell.  But thank God my son has turned his life around.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelley. That was heart felt.

text: Attention when hiring an attorney make sure you get a Contract!!! just because you meet with a lawyer an he tells about a case he have beaten make sure you ask him about the cases he lost they will forget to mention those case.?Its a drought on good lawyers not cop out lawyers here in Hsv!!!! When your so call lawyer is bickering with you an he is a paid lawyer an he tells u that’s a good deal an supposedly working for you... get rid of him if you can but if you can’t afford another attorney  make sure u but the word out on him lawyers talk the talk to get your money but don’t walk it don’t be afraid to tell your lawyer how you feel an what’s real they have they picks an chooses!! all I’m saying make sure your lawyer is a stand up type of guy this lawyer firm ain’t Upper echelon as they appear from my experience.

text: I was arrested for a DUI 2 weeks before I moved out of state about a year and a half ago. My court case was continued for quite a while, a strategy that was used to wait for the right opportunity to get my case dismissed. After a year of patience and taking a quick 2 day DUI awareness class, my DUI was dismissed to court costs and I am now in the process of filing for an expundgement. Everyone at this office has a wonderful professional attitude and are very gracious with any help they can provide. I have no desire to be in a position to need Mr. Crumbley's help again but to anyone out there needing help, he's 100% worth the price!

name: Greg Kaltz
text:
TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN-

In March of 2014 I was charged with a DUI in Madison County, Alabama. This led to several serious concerns I had as to what negative impacts this DUI might have regarding maintaining my current place of employment, a valid Alabama Driver’s License, and the potential for increased auto insurance rates. In addition, I was uninformed of all the specific issues pertaining to Alabama State Law as they apply to a DUI charge especially, with respect to possible fines, imprisonment, unknown future adverse impacts, or establishment of an unfavorable permanent criminal history. The level of stress in my daily life was extremely high, to say the least, due to this situation and these concerns.

I was referred to the Law Office(s) of Russell W. Crumbley to try and sort all these issues out. Russell put me immediately at ease and clarified for me, in a no-nonsense way, what needed to be done to effectively address the DUI charge against me. He also kept me informed as to the current status of my case as it made its way through the Alabama judicial process and provided reassuring personal representation at any and all court scheduled hearings or appointments. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND retaining Russell as your DUI Attorney should you ever find yourself in a similar situation. He is a completely knowledgeable and competent attorney in the area of Alabama DUI Criminal Law and you can rest assured that he will obtain the best possible outcome regarding your case.

Sincerely Yours-

Greg Kaltz

P.S. – Due to Russell’s expertise, he obtained a DISMISSAL of the DUI charges against me! He is also handling a follow-on expungement action for me that will clear my Alabama arrest record for DUI.

resp.text: Greg: It was a pleasure. Thank you! ~ Russell

name: Brock Grayson
text: Mr. Russell Crumbley took good care of my DUI case and was an expert in all things considered. He took the stress out of my hands and life and handled everything in a professional manner. On a Sunday, he was the only office that took my phone call, I had to be at court the next day after my arrest at 8 AM. Every office was closed, including Crumbley's. However, on his website there was a chat option in which he took my request and talked to me personally. On that very Sunday he met with me within an hour. He was on his way back from Tuscaloosa and still met with me! I've never been so stressed, but after meeting with Mr. Crumbley, he assured me I would be taken care of. The results: My case was nolle prossed: thrown out. All I had to do was sit back, and relax while Russ took care of the rest. If you want positive results, do yourself and stress level a favor and call his office and have him represent you. You will not regret it.

resp.text: Thank you, Brock, not only for those kind words but also for letting us handle your case. We consider it an honor and a privilege to work with every client that gives US that opportunity. There are options in this town. We tend to appreciate those people who choose us. Again, THANK YOU! ~ Russell

name: Refinnej
text:
Mr. Crumbley has been extremely helpful a couple times for me.  His office has been helpful and detail oriented to ensure that we knew everything that was going on and kept me up to date every step of the way.  They were always friendly and accommodating.  Even while not representing me, he was able to give me some great advice about my father's will and estate after my father had passed away.  He took the time out of his busy day to tell me what I needed to do and who it would be that I needed to find and contact once it went to probate.  This is not his area of expertise, he was just helping me know where to start.  He explained to me the process.   Since it was a large city that my father lived in, it was a while before the estate went to probate and I assumed I had been written out due to my father's controlling sister so I didn't bother looking into it until 2 years later when I was found by a life insurance company and received a letter explaining that I was the beneficiary of a policy.  I then took Mr. Crumbley's advice by finding the attorney through the probate court and found that I had many savings bonds, which the sister told me had been spent 10 years prior.  The executrix allegedly told the attorney that she tried to contact me, but she did not  Thanks to these cushions I have been able to go back to school.

I want to add, if anyone is in legal trouble, please seek counsel.  The DA will lie straight to your face.  The DA will threaten you with the highest jail terms to get you to plead guilty so they don't have to take it to trial.  Their in house legal assistants that are there to help guide defendants will tell you that if you don't take the plea "deal" that you wont win.  They are only there to help the DA, not you.  It's very difficult, especially when it's your word against law enforcement officers, many who have no problem lying in court and they're buddies with the judge.  You need someone who knows the law and knows how the courts work.  It wont be free, but it's worth it to not have to go to jail and/or have a record haunting you.  For more serious crimes, you may get a public defender, but your life is on the line with someone who may not care about you or what happens to you.  It's a dangerous risk to take and once you are convicted, it's harder to find people to listen to you.

resp.text: How kind of you. Thank you. What a mountain of burden you had going on in your life. Thanks for letting us help you navigate through it. ~ Russell

name: Bobby Caldwell
text: I hired Mr. Crumbley to help out with a pretty scary issue where I had made incredibly dumb mistakes from lack of judgment and maturity. I was worried I would lose everything, my family and my future (and I almost did) but Crumbley got me sorted out, reassured and sealed after just a couple of meetings. I wish he had been a bit cheaper and that this all never happened, but Mr. Crumbley made me feel a whole lot better while he worked. I’d hire him again, 100 percent.

resp.text: LOL! Everyone wishes lawyers were cheaper. Even lawyers when they are on the hiring end and we are ALL on that end from time to time. And, even "mature" people make mistakes so don't kick yourself. Things turned out great for you so learn from it. And, THANK YOU for your comments. ~ Russell

name: Sara Traylor
text: My husband went for a consultation about some legal issues and the lawyer he spoke with would not listen and just dismissed him without knowing all the information. I would NEVER recommend this firm to anybody.

resp.text: Sara: I am sorry you and/or your husband do not feel like he got heard the way he  should have been heard. I take it from your comment that you were not at the consultation. In either event, I would invite you and/or your husband to reach out to me via email (russ@crumbleylaw.com). Leave me a number and I will personally call you and/ or your husband at my very earliest opportunity. You certainly may come to the office but I am offering to make this as easy as possible for you. I am here for either, or both, of you. I will make sure your husband is heard. I will make sure he knows he is heard. I don't know if he has an issue we can help him with but, if we can't, I will make sure he understands that and I will make sure he understands why. If we can't help but I know someone who can I will give him a name and number of that lawyer. I am here to help - not frustrate. Thank you for your time. ~ Russell Crumbley

name: Cheryl Mellema
text:
Mr. Crumbley’s office called me the day after I posted my review of his partner, and asked if I would speak with Mr. Crumbley at his office. When I explained I was busy I was asked if I would speak with him over the phone. I agreed and I was transfered to Mr. Crumbley.  After listening to me explain my why I left the review and my account of my interactions with Mr. Matt Wisda, Mr. Crumbley asked me several questions.
1. Would I consider removing my review?
2. Would I consider moving it to Mr. Wisda’s webpage?
3. If he (Crumbley) were to fire Mr. Wisda would I then delete my review! I said no.
4. Was there ANYTHING he (Crumbley) could say or do that would result in me removing the review? To which I responded “Not ethically”, because I felt he was trying to “lead me” into asking for a monetary resolution.

During our discussion Mr. Crumbley stated he was not at all happy about Mr. Wisda’s conduct. And that he was considering actions (including termination).  He asked once more if there was anything he could do To get me to retract the review against “Crumbley, Blackwell, & Wisda Lawfirm”.  I explained to him that when I researched Divorce Attorneys/Firms I based my decision in part on the reviews of his Firms website and information regarding the lawyers and therefore would not consider removing the review. We said goodbye and I hung up.

I spent that day wondering if he would call again. I just knew “IT” wasn’t over.
So this evening I checked on my review out of curiosity...and wouldn’t you know it there is this long drawn out explanation that it was I who was misinformed etc.  Never once mentioning any unethical behavior on behalf of Mr. Wisda!
I want to SHOUT from the highest rooftops what a sleazy slimeball you are! Shall I post more? Shall I post information Mr. Wisda freely disclosed to me about a clearly VERY SENSITIVE divorce and custody battle where the children involved had been...!
You disgust me!

I retained Matt Wisda to represent me for my divorce.  I feel he acted unethically.
I contacted his office after receiving an invoice for services that were not rendered. When I followed up with an appointment a few days later not only did he begin by talking about another case he had been working on (this was the 2nd time he mentioned details of this other party's case!) but he also presented me with an official Settlement Agreement" that clearly stated me and my spouse had both agreed to - WHICH NEITHER OF US HAD!

We never went through discovery at all! No mediation - nothing!
The entire document looked copy and pasted, and all of the assets and then some were to be awarded to me!

Mr. Wisda was trying to fool me into thinking he had been hard at work on my case and that I was entitled to everything when in fact he hadn't done anything. Additionally It was never my intention to try take my husband to the proverbial cleaners. I just wanted a fair settlement.

I didn't even look at the "Settlement Agreement" he'd drawn up while at his office. I had already decided to sever our business agreement and told him so.  I asked when I could pick up my remaining retainer and he said it would be about a week.

When I went to pick up the monies, enclosed with my check was an invoice of almost $700 for the bogus "Settlement Agreement" that had been drawn up without consultation or discovery.  Coincidentally the new invoice showed just one line item for the preparing of said agreement which was dated after the phone call I mentioned above.

I immediately drew up a letter refusing to pay and insisting I be refunded.  Additionally in the letter I called him out for trying to fool me and get paid for it. I emailed this letter and received a response early the next morning stating they would immediately refund the that money, which they did.

I am leaving this review to make others aware.  In our consultation meeting he told me his practice "is like a game to me."  And because  conducting his business in such a way, I feel, is an abuse of his power as an attorney and is extremely unethical.

resp.text:
We deeply regret that your experience with our office did not meet your expectation. We work very hard to not let that happen. Having said that, you say that you received a “settlement agreement” that indicated you and your husband had agreed to the settlement terms when, in fact, you had not agreed. You also say that this agreement was put together without doing any “discovery” or any “mediation”. You initially hired Mr. Wisda to assist you in negotiating an uncontested divorce with your husband’s lawyer. In fact, you produced, for us, a “settlement agreement” created by your husband’s lawyer when you hired Mr. Wisda. That settlement agreement had already been prepared absent any “discovery” or attempt to “mediate”. It was clearly the intentions of both parties (and their lawyers) to settle this matter, if possible, without costly litigation. This type divorce typically does not involve “discovery” (in the traditional sense) and most certainly doesn’t involve “mediation”. In these type matters we simply go with settlement negotiations to the extent we are able, which necessarily includes “settlement proposals”. Also, in this type situation, both parties tend to agree that they know what the assets are and their values are not in dispute.

The “settlement agreement” your husband’s attorney prepared, and gave you, was just like the one Mr. Wisda gave you. In reviewing your husband’s proposal it is noted that it also includes language stating that the two of you “acknowledged and agreed” to things that you had not already agreed upon. In other words, both lawyers settlement agreements included the very same language in that regard. In fact, most paragraphs in all settlement agreements are full of language such as “the parties acknowledge and agree …”. This language is included to satisfy legal requirements and applies to you ONLY AFTER you have actually read it, agreed to it and signed it. It is not intended to mean that you have already seen it and agreed to it. And, it is NEVER INTENDED to deceive. Your attorney, Matt Wisda, did exactly what your husband’s lawyer did with respect to that language.

As far as the “attempt to fool you” is concerned: you received an itemized statement of the charges. You received two billing statements. The second of those two seems to be where you objected. That statement involves the “settlement agreement”. You were dissatisfied with that charge and objected to that bill and, although you had NOT notified him of your desire to terminate him until after that work was done, we refunded every penny to you of that part of the bill. And your objection, as much as any we can tell, is founded on your belief that it included the “bogus” settlement language indicating that you and your husband had agreed to the terms that you had not agreed to.

We strive to handle cases the way our clients direct us. And, while the services you received were not satisfactory to you, Mr. Wisda DID NOT bill you for services not rendered. His conduct was not unethical. His ability to communicate effectively with you, I will agree, must have missed the mark. For example, we are not sure how, exactly, you did not understand that the “acknowledged and agreed” language in the settlement agreement did not mean you had both already agreed to that agreement. That was no more the intent of what Mr. Wisda provided you than it was the intent of what your husband’s attorney provided him. It was merely two lawyers doing their jobs and adding the language that was going to be necessary at some point, in advance. Perhaps THAT is why it looked copied and pasted.

We would encourage ANYONE who is dissatisfied in ANY way, with ANYONE in our office, to meet with any of us. WE ARE ALWAYS AVAILABLE to meet with that person and do everything we can to alleviate their concern and fight for your cause. Your case matters to us. And, YOU matter to us. Best wishes moving forward during this trying time.

~ Russell Crumbley & Matt Wisda

name: Jonathan Russell
text: I came to Mr. Crumbley with a domestic violence case in Huntsville VS me. I am an aerospace engineer here in Huntsville, and, like many of you, hold a security clearance. These charges HAD to get dropped if I had any hope of keeping my clearance and my job. I had never been in any trouble before so I wasn't sure how to go about things when the public defender asked me how I wanted to plea.. she told me to plea guilty and pay the county for a class that may or may not get the charges dropped. After getting some much needed advice from a kind correctional officer outside, I declined that plea and decided to plea not-guilty and seek out my own legal counsel. I found Mr. Crumbley's office and the charges ended up being dropped/dismissed. Him and his team, even the front office, they were all excellent. Couldn't have asked for a better outcome. Now my life, my clearance and my job will remain in tact. Everyone has the blurb at the end of their advertisements saying "no representation is made that the quality of legal services performed is greater than that of other lawyers" but I'm not sure I agree with that. Mr. Crumbley really knows what he's doing and takes the time to understand where your coming from, what you are trying to do, and came up with a fantastic plan to get me there. Thanks again, to the whole office and team at Crumbley, Blackwell, Wisda and Asc.

resp.text: Wow! Thank you Jonathan for those VERY KIND words. You were very fortunate to have gotten some really good, free, advice before you even met us. You did yourself a HUGE favor in following that advice. Thank you for choosing us to represent you. It was an honor to see you through this difficulty and it was especially gratifying to us considering how easily this could have turned out differently for you. Best wishes moving forward. ~ Russell

resp.text: Chuck: I very much appreciate your considering our firm to assist you with your issues. We do every thing we can to make ourselves available to people who wish to hire us to handle their legal issues. There are, however, occasions when people do not wish to hire us (for one reason or another) or even schedule an appointment to come meet with us. Under those scenarios, our staff gives the best information they can (given the limited engagement over the phone) to help them resolve their own issues. Other than that, there is very little an attorney can do for that person. If you feel you have been dealt with less than fairly I would invite you to communicate your concerns with me by emailing me directly at russ@crumbleylaw.com. Leave your phone # and I will be glad to call you and see if I can give you a better answer than the answer you received earlier this week. I can assure you that you will feel much differently after we speak. Either way, have a good day and best wishes with you issues. ~ Russell Crumbley

Another Satisfied Client

resp.text: Wow! I have fought for clients for 21 years but, as far as I know, this is the first time a client has fought for me. I never really thought about clients reading other people's reviews before they write their own but I guess they do. I think you were more upset than I was. But, I have learned over the years that people see things, view things, expect things and interpret things differently from each other. As they say: "one man's trash is another man's treasure". EVERYTHING must be ALWAYS viewed with the proper perspective. I appreciate your strong, heartfelt words but they weren't necessary. We take cases all across the board and that includes cases that are very difficult and filled with a multitude of considerations, possibilities and opportunities - even for failure. Sometimes the absolute best outcome still falls short of the perfect outcome. I think most people understand that. Having said that, God Bless you young man. Many thanks! ~ Russell

name: mike money
text: I retained Mr. Crumbley to represent me on a DUI in the city of Madison. I had heard a lot of good things about him and his firm from other people that had used his services. I scheduled a consultation and went to meet Mr. Crumbley. I was very nervous about my situation, but within minutes he had me at ease and feeling confident we would win this case. During our meeting, Mr. Crumbley was very professional and knowledgeable and easy to talk to. I followed his advice and we took the case to a jury trial in the higher court. We were scheduled court dates several times and each time I went, the court wasn’t able to try the case at that time and would reschedule at a later date. Jump forward 6 years (that’s our court system), and the court finally scheduled a court date. So since it had been 6 years, I had moved a couple of times so the court didn’t have my current address so I was never notified of the new date. Mr. Crumbley still appeared in court on my behalf, he informed the court that he had tried to contact me but was unable to reach me. The court was talking about doing several different things, but Mr. Crumbley kept fighting on my behalf to reach a solution that was in my best interest. The day after my court date, I had a missed call, I called the number and it was Mr. Crumbley’s office. His staff found out who had tried to contact me, next thing I know, Mr. Crumbley was on the phone. He told me about the missed court date, and I’m thinking Ok, bench warrant!!! He continued to tell me the news….Case is Dismissed!!! What better outcome could there be. Thanks Russell.

resp.text: Mike: THANK YOU for that. But, I just did what you hired me to do ... I kept fighting. And, it certainly worked out better than I expected. Just goes to show ... you never know until you go try. God Bless!

resp.text: Jacob: It is very disappointing to see your level of disappointment. After a review of our records, it appears as though this review stems from issues about 10 years ago. Jon and I bend over backwards for our clients to try to get the best results possible. We have tried many cases in front of a jury. We get MOST cases dismissed and, of course,  some clients do enter a guilty plea. However, every case is different and has it's own variables, nuances and circumstances (both in fact and in law). For that reason, alone, we never make promises or guarantees - even when we believe we could. That is just not good business. The ONLY thing I know to do is to reach out to you and I have done that - to no avail. My office and my phone line remain open to you. In either event, we wish you nothing but the best. ~ Russell

name: Bob Adkins
text: My family used this attorneys office to handle the process of a large estate from probate to closing of two sales from the land and home.  This  event started in 2020 and finally resolved in spring of 2021.    The response from the members on his team has been pathetic at best.  Not returning phone calls or emails so many times.  I would have to follow up several times to make sure what I had requested was being done on various issues.   We have been told incorrect information during probate causing us a lot of extra work when it wasn't required.   Then at closing, I had to point out several items that were not correct and even the fee we were told to pay wasn't correct.  Actually, the fee was short from what was discussed and we corrected saving them a loss.   The lawyer did not seem to know the details of the closing when we pointed out discrepancies and had to go ask his staff.   The front office lady was very sweet and helpful.  However, the remaining staff we dealt with was unorganized and unprofessional.   For the amount we paid,  we feel we did not receive good service as the process and experience was difficult and frustrating throughout.   Then we still have one outstanding matter we asked for them to provide legal documents on and  over a month has passed with no communication from the office.   I have followed up 3 times and still no response.     I thought a small town attorney office would have been a very good experience to work with, but I was wrong.   I would not recommend.   I hope they improve their service.

name: Daniel Tarpley
text:
I first met Mr. Matthews over a year ago when the first stages of what would become my divorce was just beginning to surface. What started out as a simple consultation to learn what my rights would be if divorce became real would ultimately become a saving grace.

If I had to describe Mr. Matthews I would say he is a very straight shooter that will not try to sell you "hopes and dreams" or "blow smoke" just to get money out of you. He will definitely let you know where you stand and how things are, and believe me sometimes that is definitely what you need even if you may not want to hear it.

Another thing about Mr. Matthews I can say is that he has the experience and know how to go about your case. He knows the exact moment and places to strike to when it matters the most. In my own situation, Mr. Matthews delivered such an amazing defense in an emergency hearing that at that exact moment after nearly a year of feeling beaten, battered, bruised and so tired that I was about ready to give up. He managed to unravel my now ex-wife's entire testimony with just a single question. Mr. Matthews did such a good job that after a few follow up questions the judge stopped the hearing, and I didn't even have to get on the stand to defend myself.

Then a few weeks later Mediation came around, and the tone suddenly shifted from everything my ex-wife wanted to pretty much everything I wanted. I have to thank Mr. Matthews so much because thanks to him and his amazing defense I now have my name cleared, and I can be the father to my children that I always wanted to be.

I also want to extend a thank you to Mr. Matthews team. You will not find a more friendly and knowledgeable staff that is prompt with informing Mr. Matthews of your concerns and questions, and getting that information back to you.

So if what your looking for is an hometown attorney that won't steer you wrong, won't try to sell you a line, and give you a true blue unquestionable defense then  look no further than Mr. William Matthews.

name: Taylor Hayes
text: Spent 4 hours with Larry, he gave me a game plan, fed me tons of false hope, told me I have a great case, got extremely excited, signed papers with me, and said he'd represent me. Told me to keep living my life and he had everything under control. Didn't respond to phone calls and emails for a month. Then sent me a letter saying they wouldn't represent me in any of my cases but recommended I file with the EEOC and seek further legal counsel elsewhere but gave me no recommendations. I feel like I was enthusiastically lied to and now I'm at square one. Makes no sense. Very unprofessional.

name: Ada Alabama
text: Run as fast as you can away from this law firm.   If you are using them fire them right away.  They do not understand what it  is like to live in constant pain from an injury. Once you are away from them you will find out all of the things they did not bother to find out or perhaps purposely did not tell you.   Again, they will not stand up for you.   Find a better law firm.  They are useless when you need them the most.

name: Dawnelle Kay
text: During the onset of my divorce, I felt lost and overwhelmed. I googled lawyers and FAQs, anything to help me figure out what my first step needed to be. I found Adam Jones and Associates and while looking over their website, a chat popped up asking me if I needed to chat with them. I figured it was some ploy or scam to get my name and number that would lead to a flood of annoying calls, but I decided I had nothing to loose, so I chatted about my situation. It turns out, I was chatting with my future lawyer! That same week I met Niki and as soon as she shook my hand...I knew she was the answer to my prayers. Hands down, an amazing woman and a powerful lawyer. After my divorce, I brought the company I work for to Adam Jones and Associates. I can honestly say, on a personal level with my divorce and on a professional level with the cases I deal with at work, Adam Jones and Associates is my lifetime firm. One chat session lead to one phone call, one hand shake lead to one case, and now they are my lawyer, my family's lawyers, and my company's lawyers. They really do cater to their clients needs. I can not express my support for this firm enough! I remember emailing my lawyer at 3am and she was not only there for me legally, but as a friend as well. That is what makes me a forever customer, knowing my problem is not a paycheck to these guys, it is their problem too and they mean it.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, Dawnelle. And thanks for choosing our firm.  -Adam

name: Kelsey White
text: I am definitely giving Dean Waite and his office 5 stars. He was beyond everything we were looking for in an accident attorney. My husband was in a motorcycle accident at the end of January and was in the hospital for over a week. We called Dean’s office and explained the situation and they said he would call us back as soon as he reviewed our case. He personally called us back 5 minutes later. He asked if we could meet and when I told him we were in the hospital he said I will be there soon. He visited us in the hospital on a Sunday afternoon and immediately treated us like family. We went over our case and he immediately accepted it. He was in contact with us every other day or so which gave us piece of mind know he was actively working our case. After a couple of weeks we were told the Insurance company was denying our claims for the accident. We thought we had lost he case and we couldn’t do anything else. Dean worked for a few days on trying to get our claim accepted and finally after a few days it was approved. Dean is the nicest and most professional attorney I’ve met. I would HIGHLY recommend him and his office.

resp.text: Thank you Kelsey.  It was an absolute pleasure representing you and Cameron and I'm glad things worked out for you guys.  Sometimes bad things happen to good people and being able to help folks like you makes my job worthwhile!   We are here for you if you ever need us in the future.

name: Chassidy Hammond
text: I would definitely recommend Dean Wait’s office! After a car accident, the insurance company of the at-fault driver denied my medical claims. I contacted Dean Waite’s office after a friend’s recommendation. All of his staff were very friendly and helpful. I asked a lot of questions because I don’t know much about the legal process. They were patient, informative, and kept me updated. I do not live in AL (where the accident ocurred), so though I did meet Dean Waite in office on a few occasions, they allowed me to handle most matters by email. The insurance company wanted to settle out of court with partial compensation. Dean Waite’s team took my case to trial. They had to prove fault because of a lacking police report. I had to testify, and his team was very helpful in calming my nerves! Dean Waite’s office won my case and I received full compensation for my injuries. I most appreciated their availability, patience in explaining the process, and how quickly they responded to my emails (even after hours).

resp.text: Chassidy-  I"m so glad we were able to obtain a favorable result for you after the insurance company treated you so unfairly. name: Sheila Croston
text: We were hit by a school bus, which resulted in a 4 surgery case. Tabatha, an associate of Mr. Waite told my husband and me we were old and they wouldn't be able to get us much in our case, because we had existing physical problems. I guess they don't think us, 60 year olds deserve  to be treated like the victims of a school bus running a stop sign and causing, over $14,000 worth of damage to our vehicle, deserve compensation for our injuries. I would not recommend them if you are older, not sure how they treat younger people. We went with a different law firm, which was probably the best thing for us.

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Croston,

I was disappointed to see this review on Google, especially since in June 2018 we received an email from you reading "Thank you. We appreciate your hard work." I'm not sure why you have reversed course now, but I would like to take a moment to respond.

I proudly represent people of all ages and from all walks of life, and my firm and I have gotten great results for many older clients. Every case is different, and every situation has pros and cons. Part of my job as an attorney and counselor at law is to advise my clients of all factors, both positive and negative, that may affect their claims. In injury cases, age and medical history are among those factors.

We discussed with you the factors that would affect your case, as we would with any other client. While we are always cognizant of the sensitivity of these issues, in my experience, being up front and frank with my clients is the way to provide better representation and better results.

Please feel free to call me at (251) 265-1000 to discuss this matter further. I wish you the very best of luck.

Sincerely,
Attorney Dean Waite

name: nah nah
text: Very Gladly I was referred to Dean's law office.  The day after my accident, on a Saturday, Dean met me at Starbucks to discuss my case.  I am sure He handles cases involving much more money than my case, yet his helpfulness, guidance & availability to me in the weeks following my accident were stellar. 1st, I would not have gotten a car rental from the insurance company of the driver that caused my accident after mine was totaled without Dean's help/guidance. 2nd,  I texted his personal cell phone on a Saturday night after arriving at home to a high anxiety causing letter from the insurance company of the person that caused my accident.  Dean replied within 5 minutes, and with great interest in my inquiry! Asking questions i hadn't thought of in order to fully understand my status & give the most accurate reply. I was put very much at ease. 3rd, I stopped into Dean's office the 1st time unannounced by text, phone or email.  I had multiple questions ranging from money to get my stitches removed to whether I needed to obtain a police report and wanted only to speak to the staff member in charge of my case.  Before I could finish saying my name to the receptionist, Dean exited his office and greeted me. And although he had a meeting in 20 minutes & i offered to just ask a staff member, he wouldn't leave until all of my 5 or 6 questions were personally answered.  4th, Attorney Derek Siebert, in charge of my case, did a phenomenal job for me.  He contacted me multiple times to explain my options & offer opinion if I desired. He was truly in my corner for me.  Lastly, but very very impressive to me, every member of Dean's staff i had any interaction with treated me with great courtesy & with professionalism.  I felt very & truly cared for as a client.  I wouldn't recommend any one else.

resp.text:
Ms. Moore- I was certainly disappointed to see your review.  After investigating your claim, we determined that there was no automobile insurance coverage available to cover your car accident.  As such, we sent a letter to you advising you that we could not handle your case.  This letter was sent to the address we had on file for you.  I am sorry if you somehow never received word of our decision.  This is honestly the first time I've heard that you were not aware that we couldn't represent you.

I certainly wish you the best.   Please give me a call if you'd like to discuss this matter in greater detail.  I'm more than happy to talk with you about it.

Dean Waite

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Robinson,

I was disappointed to see your negative review on Google concerning my firm and wanted to take a moment to respond. While I do remember speaking with you about your potential case, I need to point out that I declined to represent you and you were never an actual client of my firm. Unfortunately, there are many reasons why I may not be able to accept a particular case. When I believe I will not be able to reach a positive outcome, I make it my policy to decline the case in order to avoid setting unrealistic expectations for the injured person.

Out of respect for your privacy I will not share the details of why I was not able to represent you in this public forum, but please feel free to call me at (251) 265-1000 and I would be happy to offer further explanation. I wish you the very best of luck.

Sincerely,
Attorney Dean Waite

Dear Ms. Shamburger,

We strive for every single client to have a great experience and almost all do. In your case, we went to great lengths to reduce our attorney’s fee and get your medical bills reduced as much as possible so that you would walk away with the greatest possible amount of money for your injuries. We understand that every client comes to us in a bad situation, with all the understandable frustrations that come along with it, and we work hard every day to help make the best possible outcome out of such situations.

I would welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns at any time.  Feel free to give me a call or just drop by the office.  I hope you and your family have a wonderful holiday season.

Attorney Dean Waite

name: Joyce Edwards
text: Mr. Smith and his paralegal Ms. Mason went above and beyond to obtain the best possible settlement in my divorce. Because this was the end of a 33 year marriage they were very thorough in obtaining all the information needed in order to have a fair division of financial and property assets, along with the facts needed in obtaining a fair alimony settlement. I had moved to another state for my own peace of mind, but I was always kept informed. I did have to return for a temporary support hearing and mediation, which was to be expected. From the time my ex-spouse was served with papers to the finalization of the the divorce was about 7 months.  I feel very blessed that Mr. Smith and Ms. Mason were able to bring closure as quickly as they did in my contested divorce process. Mr. Smith knows the family law concerning divorce matters and can go about this process in a calm and respectful manner to everyone that's involved yet get his point across in the best interest of his client. If you are needing a divorce lawyer that will be looking out for you - his client I highly recommend Mr. Smith and his staff.

resp.text: Joyce, thank you very much for the wonderful review. We genuinely appreciate all of the positive feedback.

name: Marsida Cami
text: Reply to Brian Sullivan: Please dont advertise lies about this law firm you told me numerous times how disappointed you were in their services, Mr. Mcghee gave Mr. Sullivan a percentage off his legal fees, if he gave a good review!! False advertisement Really!! My true story: My now ex husband and I went through a chaotic divorce and his lawyer was Mr. McGhee. My experience is based on what I dealt with in phone and email conversations as well as what was told to me by my ex husband and McGhee's  Secretary and how the divorce was handled. First Mr. Mcghee, does not like to speak to people that are "Pro Se" (representing yourself) so even though you worked for over 10 years in the law field as a paralegal and you can easily save your money by doing the settlement and divorce yourself, Shawn McGhee will make sure to give you a hard time. Not only does he lie and says there is a conflict of interest, which is why he won't speak to you which by the way, THAT IS NOT TRUE, but he will not answer any of the calls. For whatever reason he was not able to speak to me which to me seems very unprofessional, he would often have his secretary let me know what was needed for the divorce to be settled. I think because I do know what I needed to do legally, and trust me lawyers hate people that have worked in law fields you cant pull a sheet over legal assistants or paralegals eyes easily, we know all the tricks.  Now his secretary had given me some information that had holes in what she said that included the discovery process and hearings as well as the laws. Because of the communication between me and her and then what she told my ex husband of what I said, which were twisted, this made the divorce messy and long . And I believe the reason was for trial which is very expensive, but lawyers love expensive. Now one thing which is grounds for a grievance is that Mr. McGhee gave advice on the amount of payments for child support that should be paid which is unethical and should only be done by a referee. Mr. Mcghee, has no compassion for children as he informs his clients that they don't need to be responsible parents and pay for the kids until a judge says so, which to me makes me wonder about his character. Being out of state I was not able to do much, and my ex did not even live in Alabama as law requires in order to file but as usual somehow McGhee got around that. I have worked for law firms since I was 16 years old I could never work for someone that does things that are unethical, shady and down right wrong  he has no moral character, and I would be scared if my papers would be questioned by a judge with the amount of lies that my ex and his lawyer gave to me.  Please look at other Law firms that will look at your case and care enough to not control your decisions and won't run up your bill for no reason. Me and my ex husband  managed to settle together without the hearsay talk of his lawyer. The issue I have is there are amazing lawyers out there and Mr. Mcghee is the reason that lawyers have such a bad reputation. Make sure you chose a lawyer that will care about your interests and especially the kids, don't let the kids get lost in the divorce they are the most important thing, don't let the lawyer stress you or the other party or you will cause more harm and extend something that is not good for anyone. And make sure to hold your ground. Research on your lawyer don't chose someone because they are cheap eventually they will show you why they are cheap, Mr. Mcghee was affordable for my ex-husband until hearings and trial came around and then up goes his hourly. Don't be fooled.

resp.text: At Smith & McGhee, we always strive to treat our clients with the utmost of respect and professionalism and we work tirelessly on their behalf. We also recognize that, unfortunately, not every case has a positive outcome, nor do the facts of every case warrant continued legal action. But, we always advise our clients of their best options and remedies. In our continued efforts to address any negative responses to our Google Comments, we have reviewed our client records to try and locate your file. Unfortunately we do not have any records of you being a client of our firm. This leaves us no way to answer your negative review except to assume you may have reviewed the wrong law firm.  If you feel this is in error, please feel free to contact our office at your earliest convenience to discuss any issues or questions you may have.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. name: Steve Hallman
text: We recently had the stressful burden of a child support situation change our lives. Involved in a case that had never been before the Alabama Courts, we had no idea if we should fight or roll over and (pay)dead.  I am far from being a quitter but sometimes you feel that there is nothing or no one that can help you and the ones you care for. Sometimes it seems that the Justice system is anything but just. This is exactly how we felt all the way up to our final hearing. We new we were going to need an intelligent and thorough attorney. We researched and asked people who we should use and was referred to Mark. We went and talked with him and he took our case, but told us he couldn't promise anything. He told us that he would do the best he could, and that was all we could ask for. We just wanted what was fair and felt it was worth the fight. After trying to go to court without an attorney and seeing how that was going we just knew we had to have representation. Our finances were extremely tight and we worried that it might just all be for naught. It seemed the law just didn't have anything to protect us. Mark Gober searched and searched and found cases in several other states that supported our side, and gave us some hope. Still we were concerned that it could go either way. We even were concerned that the truth was not going to come out because everyone kept saying that it was all irrelevant. Even with all of the negative things we were hearing  we stuck it out and kept fighting because we felt that it mattered. We wanted our case to maybe help someone else in the future. Mark surpassed anything that we could have expected when we got in the courtroom for our final hearing. We were amazed by how thorough he was without even having to bring every detail into it (which could have taken a lot more time and cost us a whole lot more money). I could not believe it when he actually got them to admit things on the stand that showed exactly what was going on. Justice was truly done as much as it could possibly be thanks to Mark. This was a case for me of right vs. wrong and the good won out. Thank you so much for all that you have done for our family. You are a wonderful attorney and we will definitely tell everyone we know or talk with how hard you worked for us. You went above and beyond, and we now have faith that the Justice system can work.

resp.text: Thank you so much for those kind words. This was most definitely a case of "right vs. wrong" it was my pleasure to work with you and Jennifer.

If it has to go to court he will let you know when it is time. He gives plenty of advice of what to do. He is honest in every way possible. He is very respectful. I would recommend to anybody I know.

name: Christopher A.
text:
Mike treats you like a human, even when you're feeling like you're just a number to the court.
He took on a pretty horrible messed up situation, taking all that nervousness and worry away and helped work a situation through the whole process, all the way to a successful conclusion.

He is someone I would want to have on my side. The cost is commensurate for services rendered. Leave it at that.
Thank you for everything, Mike.

Highly recommended.

text:
Great lawyer.
impressive work

text: The attorney's were very knowledgeable about auto accident claims.  They carefully explained all the technical and legal terms.  They kept me informed all throughout the case.  I would highly recommend this law firm to be well represented when dealing with insurance claims.

name: Alex Hunt
text: Mr. John Lloyd did an exceptional job I was in a terrible accident and he helped me throughout the entire process dealing with the difficult insurance companies. He also helped me thoroughly understand my options. I would would have to recommend his legal services for anyone who finds themselves in a similar situation.

name: Keith Crowe
text: John has been my lawyer for about 6 years now. He’s worked diligently on every thing that I’ve asked of him. He has a great head on his shoulders. Always looking out for other people. Always overly prepared for every case he’s involved in. I think he’s only lost 1 case in his life. He will be my lawyer for a very long time. I wish I could give him more than 5 stars because he deserves it! One of the best people I know!

name: miranda skurka
text:
Mr. Lloyd made my case one of the easiest experiences of my life. After my car accident I didn’t know what I was going to do but he assured me that he would handle everything and he kept his word.
My settlement helped me get back on my feet, pay off bills that built up from be being out of work with more than enough to sit on while I recovered. I even took a vacation. I give him a 10/10.

name: Dylan Murray
text: I give Mr. Lloyd a 10 star. He helped me win a civil case. He was prepared and on point. You can tell he has an amazing work ethic. Very organized, well spoken, and educated on the law. I highly recommend him to anyone that needs his services.

text: Michael Cartee is an amazing lawyer as well as person. He is full of perseverance and very dedicated to everything he does as well as being an amazing caring friend not only just a lawyer!!!

text: Michael Cartee and John Lloyd are the pitbulls of Tuscaloosa lawyers. They have won numerous Awards in the past 3 to 5 years that distinguishes them amongst other lawyers. I highly recommend them to anyone.

I thank you Mr. Cartee for what you have done for me during  my time of need for my divorce.. I would recommend Cartee & Lloyd to anyone in need of a awesome and professional Attorney.

name: Sallie Dozier
text: Tracy Cary is the most genuine, Christian professional I've ever been privileged to know. Hiring an attorney was a burden I wasn't looking forward to going through, especially when life was already in upheaval. Lawyers get a bad rap, anyway. You rarely hear good things. Well, these people aren't the ones they write bad jokes about. They ACTUALLY care, they're concerned. Tracy became invested in me as a person, not a payout. My family and I MATTERED. You can't go wrong choosing them. I had God, my family, and Tracy Cary.

name: Daniel Dobbs
text: Joey Morris is the best attorney around! He's a good man and really knows his stuff. His paralegal Sherri is awesome too. Both of them are very compassionate and eager to put in the work necessary for the case. I never expected to receive as much money as I did, especially in the short amount of time it took to complete my case. He was always available when I needed to talk to him, and he answered all of my questions and kept me informed along the way. Thanks for all your help!

resp.text: Thanks for recognizing Joey and Sherri and their work for you!

name: Shelly Hussey
text: Cary represented me after a car accident I was in. I was hesitant at first because I had never had to hire a lawyer for something like this before. Mr. Cary and the staff were so kind, understanding and helpful. I emailed him quite often during this process and he was always very quick with a reply. I would HIGHLY recommend him!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the vote of confidence!

name: Ronee Renee
text: Joey Morris is the best attorney I've ever met. Very professional, informative, thorough, and compassionate. The entire experience was a breeze and only took a few months because he and his paralegal really know what they are doing. He is very familiar with insurance policies and their tricky wording. Great man at a great firm!

name: Ronda Young
text: Our son was killed in a motorcycle accident we first met with Tracy Cary and he was so kind and professional, as the case moved forward Joey Morris was very involved.  All I can say is both of these attorneys were amazing and the paralegal Sherri is so professional and kind.  We thank you all for helping us through the worst time of our life!  This law firm is the best, they are so good at what they do and I feel like I have new friends.

resp.text: Thanks for the review.  We were very moved by your family’s love for your son.

name: Trey Horton
text: Went in, Very old guy.... I told him about some tax things I would like to take care of. Paid him $500 - he said he was going to the IRS to pull my transcripts (that can be pulled online) the next day so when I met him next I asked to see them. Since he said he spent all day down there getting them and used the $500 I paid him.. . He could not produce them. Never saw them. I asked him what I needed to do, he offered no sort of plan, no sort of advice. Said let's offer them xyz and see what they say.... Give me a break. I can do that myself...   Never went back. hate being lied to. Lost $500 beware...
